posts.text: ##Hey, today Iâ€™m sharing some shots I snapped in Santiago de Chile, where I lived a few years ago. From the Atacama in the North to the Patagonia in the South, Chile is a fascinating country with so much to offer. I was lucky enough to work in the capital and in the lovely city ConcepciÃ³n later. I didnâ€™t take so many photos in these 2 cities with my camera as I did when traveling to other destinations - I guess you know what I mean? Perhaps people take more pictures when they visit somewhere as a tourist, but kind of take it for granted and ignore the beauty around their living place. Itâ€™s great to see there are some challenges on Steemit to enrouge users to dicover and capture the moments in their daily life. So here we go! First letâ€™s have an overview of the city from a hilltop: å¤§å®¶å¥½~ ä»Šå¤©åˆ†äº«ä¸€äº›åœ¨æ™ºåˆ©é¦–éƒ½åœ£åœ°äºšå“¥çš„éšæ‹ã€‚å› ä¸ºçœ‹åˆ°@whereinçš„ã€Œ å¸¦æˆ‘çœ‹çœ‹ï¼Œä½ çš„åŸå¸‚ã€æ´»åŠ¨ï¼ŒåŠ¨å‘˜å¤§å®¶â€œæ‹æ‘„ä½ çš„åŸå¸‚ç¬é—´â€ï¼Œè§‰å¾—å¾ˆæœ‰æ„æ€ã€‚æœ€å–œæ¬¢åˆ†äº«ç…§ç‰‡å•¦ï¼Œç„¶é¹…ã€‚ã€‚ã€‚æˆ‘ç°åœ¨ä½çš„åœ°æ–¹åœ¨éƒŠåŒºï¼Œè¯´å¾—å¥½å¬ç‚¹å°±æ˜¯å›å½’å¤§è‡ªç„¶ï¼Œéš¾å¬ç‚¹å°±æ˜¯é¸Ÿéƒ½ä¸æ‹‰å±ï¼Œå¹¶æ²¡æœ‰åŸå¸‚ç¬é—´å¯ä»¥åˆ†äº«ï˜†ã€‚æ‰€ä»¥æˆ‘æƒ³ï¼Œè¿˜æ˜¯æ¥å‘äº›ä»¥å‰ä½è¿‡çš„åŸå¸‚çš„ç…§ç‰‡ï¼Œæ¯”å¦‚å…¶ä¸­çš„æ™ºåˆ©é¦–éƒ½ï¼Œè¿™ä¹Ÿæ˜¯æˆ‘åŠ å…¥Steemçš„åˆè¡· â€” ç£ä¿ƒè‡ªå·±æ•´ç†æµ·é‡å½±åƒã€‚åºŸè¯ä¸å¤šè¯´ï¼Œå…ˆä¸Šæ€»è§ˆå›¾ï¼Œä¹Ÿå°±æ˜¯çˆ¬åˆ°å±±é¡¶ä¿¯ç°åŸå¸‚çš„ç…§ç‰‡ï¼š ##Cerro San CristÃ³bal is a hill offering a general view of Santiago. You can climb up on foot or take the funicular. The lookout area is also a great place to taste the traditional Chilean drink mote con huesillos (see the picture below). Made of a kind of grain(mote), dried peach(huesillo) and sugary water, this cold drink is truly refreshing in the heat. You can find this popular drink all over the streets in Santiago during summer time. Compared to the strong cocktail classic Pisco claimed as a creation by both Peru and Chile, this sweet drink works more magic for me. :) I talked about it in this post if you are interested. Besides, you can have fun at other sites on this hill, like the pools, the park, the zoo and the castle. åœ£å…‹é‡Œæ–¯æ‰˜å·´å±±é¡¶æ˜¯ä¸€å¤„ä¿¯ç°å…¨åŸçš„å®åœ°ã€‚å½“åœ°äººå’Œæ¸¸å®¢éƒ½å¾ˆå–œæ¬¢æ¥è¿™ä¸ªå¤§è‡ªç„¶å…¬å›­ç©è€ã€‚ä»ä¸‹é¢çš„åœ°å›¾ä¸Šå¯ä»¥çœ‹åˆ°ï¼Œè¿™ç‰‡å±±ä¸Šæœ‰åŠ¨ç‰©å›­ã€åœ£æ¯æ®¿ã€æ¸¸æ³³æ± ã€åŸå ¡ç­‰å¾ˆå¤šå»å¤„ã€‚è‡ªå·±çˆ¬ä¸Šå»æˆ–è€…åç¼†è½¦éƒ½å¯ä»¥ã€‚ å±±é¡¶çš„å‡‰äº­é‡Œæœ‰è´©å–æ™ºåˆ©å›½é¥® - mote con huesillosï¼ˆä¸‹å›¾æˆ‘å–çš„é‚£æ¯ï¼‰ã€‚ä»¥å‰åœ¨è¿™ä¸ªå¸–å­é‡Œ (ä¸‹é¢æœ€åä¸€å¼ ç…§ç‰‡)è®²è¿‡æ™ºåˆ©äººå’Œç§˜é²äººäº‰æŠ¢çš„å›½é¥® - æŸ æª¬å£å‘³çš„çš®æ–¯ç§‘é…¸åˆ©å£é…’ã€‚è€Œé…’é‡ä¸è¡Œå¦‚æˆ‘ï¼Œè¿˜æ˜¯è§‰å¾—è¿™ç§ä¼ ç»Ÿçš„æ— é…’ç²¾ç³–æ°´æ›´åŠ æ¸…ç”œå¯å£ã€‚å®ƒæ˜¯ç”¨å—ç¾çš„å°éº¦moteã€å¹²æ¡ƒhuesilloå’Œç³–æ°´æ··åˆè€Œæˆçš„ã€‚æœ‰ç‚¹åƒè–ç±³æ°´ï¼Œæ˜¯æ™ºåˆ©å¤å¤©è¡—å¤´å¸¸è§çš„æ¶ˆæš‘é¥®å“ã€‚ Itâ€™s quite dry and sunny in summer time. So warm-toned photos are pretty common. As a result, the sunsets here are just brilliant. When it rains, the mostly snowcapped Andes mountains at the backdrop can be viewed more clear. Itâ€™s such a magnificent scene that appears frequently in postcards of the city. è¿™ä¸ªåŸå¸‚ç¦»åŒ—è¾¹çš„æ²™æ¼ åœ°å¸¦ä¸è¿œï¼Œå¾ˆå¹²æ—±ï¼Œå¤å¤©æ—¶ç»å¸¸æ˜¯å‡ ä¸ªæœˆéƒ½è§ä¸åˆ°ä¸€æ»´é›¨ã€‚ä¹Ÿå› æ­¤å¸¸æœ‰å£®ä¸½çš„è½æ—¥æ™¯è±¡ã€‚éšä¾¿ä¸€æ‹å°±æ˜¯æš–è‰²è°ƒï¼Œæˆ‘å–œæ¬¢ï¼Œä½ å‘¢ï¼Ÿå¦‚æœé‡ä¸Šç½•è§çš„é›¨æ°´ï¼Œè¿œå¤„è‹è½è¿ç»µçš„å®‰ç¬¬æ–¯å±±è„‰å°±è¶Šå‘æ¸…æ™°èµ·æ¥ï¼Œç™½é›ªçš‘çš‘çš„ç¾¤å±±ç¯æŠ±æ•´åº§åŸçš„ç¾æ™¯ï¼Œä¹Ÿæˆä¸ºæ˜ä¿¡ç‰‡ä¸Šçš„å¸¸å®¢ã€‚ ##This skyscraper is Costanera Center Torre 2, better known as Gran Torre Santiago (Great Santiago Tower). 64 stories, it is the tallest in Latin America. You can easily see this building from different corners of the city. è¿™åº§64å±‚çš„é«˜æ¥¼æ˜¯åœ£åœ°äºšå“¥éšå¤„å¯è§çš„åœ°æ ‡ï¼Œä¹Ÿæ˜¯æ‹‰ç¾æœ€é«˜çš„å»ºç­‘ã€‚ä¸‹é¢å‡ å±‚æ˜¯å•†åœºï¼Œä¸Šé¢å¾ˆå¤šå±‚ç©ºç½®ï¼Œå¸¸å¹´äºæœ¬ã€‚ ##Atop the hill, like Rio de Janeiroâ€™s Christ the Redeemer, La Virgen (Virgin Mary) and her sanctuary overlooks the city. Though not as stunning as the view of Rio with all the bays and the vast sea, you can still have a taste of nature and enjoy the picturesque vista with the towering Andean mountains standing in distance. å°±åƒå·´è¥¿é‡Œçº¦çƒ­å†…å¢å±±å·…çš„åŸºç£åƒä¸€æ ·ï¼ˆæˆ‘æ–‡æœ«çš„æ‹¼å›¾é‡Œæœ‰ç…§ç‰‡ï¼‰ï¼Œè¿™é‡Œçš„å±±é¡¶ä¹Ÿæœ‰åœ£æ¯ç›ä¸½äºšä¿¯ç°ç€æ•´åº§åŸå¸‚çš„èŠ¸èŠ¸ä¼—ç”Ÿã€‚è™½ç„¶çœ‹ä¸åˆ°é‡Œçº¦é‚£ç§æƒŠä¸–çš„ç»ç¾é£æ™¯ï¼Œæ¯•ç«Ÿäººå®¶æœ‰å±±æœ‰æµ·æœ‰æµ…æ¹¾ï¼Œè¿˜æœ‰æ•°ä¸æ¸…çš„çƒ­è¾£ç¾å¥³åœ¨æ²™æ»©ä¸Šå¬‰æˆï¼Œç¡®å®æœ‰ç‚¹éš¾ä»¥åŒ¹æ•Œå•Šï¼›ä¹Ÿæ²¡æœ‰çº½çº¦é¦™æ¸¯è¿™ç§ç¹åå¤§éƒ½å¸‚çš„æ»¡çœ¼æ‘©å¤©æ¥¼ï¼Œä½†è¿œçœºä¸‹é‚£ä¸€åº§åº§å®ä¼Ÿçš„å®‰ç¬¬æ–¯å±±ï¼Œåœ¨è‹æ¾ç¿ æŸã€æ£•æ¦ˆç¹èŠ±çš„æ©æ˜ ä¸‹ï¼Œå‘¼å¸ç‚¹å¹²ç‡¥çš„æ–°é²œç©ºæ°”ä¹Ÿä¸èµ–å‘€~ =) ##The following pictures are about the colorful streets/architectures in the city. They were mostly taken by an old crappy phone, so it might have hard time doing justice of the real vibrant colors there. :) ä¸‹é¢æ˜¯ä¸€ç»„åæ˜ å¤šå½©è¡—é“å’Œå»ºç­‘çš„éšæ‹ï¼Œå› ä¸ºæ˜¯ä½åœ¨é‚£é‡Œï¼Œä¹Ÿå°±å¾ˆå°‘å¸¦ç€ç›¸æœºåˆ°å¤„æ‹ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥åªæ˜¯åœ¨è·¯ä¸Šçœ‹åˆ°ä»€ä¹ˆæœ‰æ„æ€çš„å°±æå‡ºå°æ‰‹æœºæ¥å’”åš“ä¸€ä¸‹ï¼Œè€Œå½“æ—¶çš„æ‰‹æœºå·²ç»æ˜¯è€å¤è‘£ï¼Œä¹Ÿè®¸ä¸èƒ½å¾ˆå¥½åœ°è¿˜åŸé‚£äº›å¤šå½©çš„ç¬é—´ã€‚ä½†å·ç§°å—ç¾æœ€ä¸ºä¿å®ˆçš„å›½å®¶ä¹‹ä¸€ï¼Œåœ¨ç”¨è‰²æ–¹é¢è¿˜æ˜¯èƒ½äº®çæˆ‘ä»¬è¿™äº›ä¸œäºšäººçš„çœ¼ï¼Œå“ˆå“ˆã€‚ã€‚ã€‚å€’æ˜¯æœ‰ç‚¹æƒ³å¿µè¿™ç‰‡å¤šå½©çš„åœŸåœ°äº†~ .JPG) .jpg) .jpg) .jpg) .jpg) .jpg) .jpg) .jpg) .JPG) .JPG) .JPG) .JPG) .JPG) ##Ok, so this one is mainly of people, and Iâ€™d love to share more people shots next time. :) åˆšæ‰å‘äº†ä¸€å †è¡—å¤´æ¶‚é¸¦å’Œå»ºç­‘ç±»ï¼Œå†æ¥å¼ äººç‰©çš„ï¼Œä»¥åä¼šåˆ†äº«æ›´å¤šäººç‰©çš„æŠ“æ‹ï¼Œæ¯•ç«Ÿå†å¤šå½©çš„æ¶‚é¸¦å’Œå»ºç­‘ï¼Œä¹Ÿéƒ½æ˜¯äººåˆ›é€ å‡ºæ¥çš„ã€‚ .jpg) At last, some pictures about a market, since itâ€™s #marketfriday initiated by @dswigle. Iâ€™m happy to join this challenge and share some market fun! =) My first appartment in Santiago is not far from Mercado Central de Santiago. You can buy fresh fish and seafood here, as well as dining in the food court indoors. Another popular produce market is La Vega Central. This lively expansive place will ensure you a full-on sensory experience, with all those diverse sights, smells and sounds. The fresh produce I miss the most from Chile is the avocado (they call it â€œpaltaâ€ there) - so cheap, fresh and tasty! Also, cherries, stawberries, chirimoya, lÃºcuma, Maqui berriesâ€¦ ï˜ But since I saw myself as a local when living next to a big market, I didnâ€™t take decent pictures there despite visiting it often. So I will share much more market photos in future from other places, such as the artstic city nearby - ValparaÃ­so (because I went there as a tourist ;p)! æœ€åè¿™å‡ å¼ æ˜¯å…³äºæ°´æœæ‘Šçš„ã€‚å½“æ—¶åœ¨åœ£åœ°äºšå“¥çš„ç¬¬ä¸€é—´å…¬å¯“å°±ç§Ÿåœ¨ä¸€ä¸ªå¤§å¸‚åœºæ—è¾¹ï¼Œä½œä¸ºä¸€ä¸ªåœ£åœ°äºšå“¥çš„â€œå½“åœ°äººâ€ï¼Œå‡ ä¹æ¯å¤©å»é‚£é‡Œä¹°èœçš„æˆ‘ï¼Œæ˜¯ä¸å±‘äºåƒä¸ªå‚»å‚»çš„æ¸¸å®¢ä¸€æ ·åˆ°å¤„çæ‹çš„ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥å‡ ä¹æ²¡æœ‰æ‰¾åˆ°ä»€ä¹ˆå¸‚åœºçš„ç…§ç‰‡ï˜†ã€‚ä¸‹æ¬¡ä¼šåˆ†äº«ä½œä¸ºâ€œæ¸¸å®¢â€å»æ—è¾¹çš„å¬‰çš®å°åŸValparaÃ­soæ‹çš„å¸‚åœºï¼Œä½œä¸ºæ¸¯å£åŸå¸‚ï¼Œé‚£é‡Œçš„å¸‚åœºè§„æ¨¡æ›´å¤§ï¼Œæ²¿ç€ç å¤´ä¸€å­—æ’å¼€ï¼Œå¾ˆå€¼å¾—ä¸€çœ‹ã€‚æ™ºåˆ©æœ‰ç€é•¿é•¿çš„æµ·å²¸çº¿ï¼Œä¸€èˆ¬çš„ç”Ÿé²œå¸‚åœºéƒ½æ˜¯é™¤äº†ç“œæœè”¬èœã€æµ·é²œé±¼è‚‰ä¹‹å¤–ï¼Œä¼šæœ‰å¾ˆå¤šå°é¤é¦†ç°åšç¾é£Ÿï¼Œé£Ÿå®¢å¯ä»¥åä¸‹ç‹‚åƒï¼Œå°±åƒäºšæ´²å•†åœºé‡Œçš„food courtï¼Œåªæ˜¯ç±»ä¼¼å¤šæ•°è¥¿é¤ï¼Œå¤§å¤šå¯¡æ·¡æ— å‘³ã€‚ æ— è®ºå¦‚ä½•ï¼Œæˆ‘è¿˜æ˜¯å¾ˆæƒ³å¿µå¾ˆæƒ³å¿µæ™ºåˆ©çš„ç‰›æ²¹æœç‰›æ²¹æœçš„ï¼Œçœ‹çœ‹ä¸‹å›¾å°±çŸ¥é“äº†ï¼Œç®€ç›´æ— å¤„ä¸åœ¨ï¼Œæ–°é²œå¥½åƒè¿˜ä¾¿å®œï¼è·Ÿè¥¿åŒ—æ¬§è¿™äº›è¶…å¸‚é‡Œå–çš„å¹²ç¡¬æ— å‘³çš„è¡¨å¼Ÿä»¬å®Œå…¨ä¸å¯åŒæ—¥è€Œè¯­ã€‚å°±åƒå½“åœ°äººä¸€æ ·ï¼Œå‡ ä¹æ¯é¡¿éƒ½ä¼šç”©å¼€è†€å­åƒä¸ªå¤Ÿã€‚è¿˜æœ‰è¿˜æœ‰ï¼Œå¤§æ¨±æ¡ƒã€å¤§è‰è“ã€ç•ªè”æ(é‡Šè¿¦æœ)ã€è›‹é»„æœã€é©¬åŸºè“æœã€‚ã€‚ã€‚ã€‚ã€‚ã€‚å¥½é¥¿ï¼Œå†™ä¸ä¸‹å»äº†ã€‚ã€‚ã€‚ .jpg) .jpg) .jpg) .JPG) .jpg) ##So thatâ€™s it for today. Hope you like these snapshots! As you can see, itâ€™s only the first post about this city, so much more are coming. Stay tuned and see you soon! :) é‚£å¥½ï¼Œä»Šå¤©çš„ç¬¬ä¸€é›†éšæ‹å°±å…ˆåˆ°è¿™é‡Œã€‚è¿˜æœ‰å¤ªå¤šç…§ç‰‡è¦åˆ†äº«ï¼Œä¸‹æ¬¡è§ï¼=) ## Here are some more COLOURFUL posts I did about Latin America earlier (still updating this list):è¿™é‡Œæœ‰ä¸€äº›ä»¥å‰å‘çš„å¤šå½©æ‹‰ç¾ï¼š BRAZIL:Colorful Olinda & San JuanNiemeyerâ€™s Artwork Through My Lens (1) BOLIVIA:Flamingos PERU:Traditional Clothing in Peruâ€™s Colca CanyonTrekking in Rainbow Mountains in Peru ARGENTINA:Colorful CaminitoHike with Me in El ChaltÃ©n (1) CHILE:Reach Torres del Paine in a Different Way!Follow Me to Grey Glacier (1) Follow Me to Grey Glacier (2) Explore Easter Island with Me (1) - Introduction and AnakenaExplore Easter Island with Me (2) - Best Sunset Spot Ahu Akivi COLOMBIA:Exploring Comuna 13 of MedellÃ­nColombian Coffee Triangleâ€™s Fun Vehicle - Willys Jeep CUBA:The Wild Cuban Beach and Dying Mangroves PUERTO RICO:An Abandoned Boat on the Island of Vieques â€¦â€¦ All content by @itchyfeetdonicaå›¾æ–‡ by Donicaå¤š Thank you for visiting! Check out my posts on Steemit World Map, and follow me for more adventures around the globe!ä¸‹é¢æ˜¯æˆ‘çš„ä¸€äº›æ—…é€”æ‘„å½±ã€‚æ¬¢è¿æŸ¥çœ‹æˆ‘çš„Steemitä¸–ç•Œåœ°å›¾ï¼Œè·Ÿæˆ‘ä¸€èµ·ç¯æ¸¸ä¸–ç•Œ~ï¼ !steemitworldmap -33.415942 lat -70.623307 long d3scr This page is synchronized from the post: â€˜#179 Santiago Snapshots (1) ï“· | æ™ºåˆ©é¦–éƒ½éšæ‹ï¼ˆä¸€ï¼‰â€™ document.querySelectorAll('.not-gallery-item') .forEach(el => { if (!el.dataset.src) { return; } const img = document.createElement('img'); img.style = 'display:none !important;'; img.src = el.dataset.src; img.addEventListener('error', () => { img.remove(); el.style.color = 'inherit'; el.style.backgroundImage = 'none'; el.style.background = 'none'; }); img.addEventListener('load', () => { img.remove(); }); document.body.appendChild(img); });

posts.title: #180  2nd Call - Come Joinã€Cross-culture Challengeã€‘ğŸ | ç»§ç»­å¬é›†~æ¥å‚åŠ ã€è·¨æ–‡åŒ–æ´»åŠ¨ã€‘+ å‚èµ›ç¾æ–‡æ¬£èµ
posts.text: ï‘† photo by me in La Paz, Bolivia ##Greetings everyone! Time flies - Iâ€™ve joined Steemit for over a year, and I am grateful for many communities and friends that have been constantly supporting and inspiring me. To celebrate this anniversary and to give back to the Steem community, I am hosting a cross-culture challenge. (Thanks @Partiko for sponsoring part of the rewards!) Letâ€™s join some fun in this bear market! :) ##So why a cross-culture challenge? â“ Like I said in my intro post: Iâ€™m most enthusiastic about traveling, photography, cooking, artâ€¦ I believe any traveler understands this wanderlust - you just canâ€™t have enough. By traveling far and wide, you discover new ways of living and understand other cultures to appreciate them, you constantly get inspired and would ultimately better yourself. Especially when you travel solo, you set yourself free and interact more with locals. You start to judge less and accept more.â€¦I do, like many of you foodies there, take great pleasure in eating and cooking. And I try to learn cooking from different cultures during my travels, to spice up my own experiments on food fusionâ€¦ ##There is a great variety of cultures on this planet, and each culture has its own charm. Lived across 5 continets and traveled to over 60 countries, I have been mesmerised by all the different cultures. Steemians here come from all over the world with rich cultural backgrounds. It would be fun to exchange some ideas/photos/videosâ€¦ Exchange makes change. Live and let live. So my challenge will focus on â€œcross-cultureâ€. To join this challenge, you just need to compare 2 or more cultures that you have experienced. Any form of content is welcome, you can write a short essay, post a photo story, create a drawing/painting/animation/design, share a quick video, record your voice of talking or singingâ€¦ all fine! It would be great to hear your personal stories soaking up in different cultures. Share your inspiration with us! ##Then what is culture? ï§ Back in my uni course of Cultural Studies, thereâ€™s been heated discussion about what exactly culture is. To some extent, it seems almost everything can be seen as culture. To give you a bit inspiration, hereâ€™s one of the definitions: Culture is the characteristics and knowledge of a particular group of people, encompassing language, religion, cuisine, social habits, music and arts, etc.. ##https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/itchyfeetdonica/YwGYWSTB-SingaporeKampongGlam.JPGï‘† photo by me in Kampong Glam, Singapore ##So thatâ€™s it, just go pick a cultural topic (language, religion, cuisine, social habits, music and arts, etc..) from 2 or more particular groups of people that you are familiar with, and show the differences to us in a certain form. Inspire me and other Steemians! Tell us any culture shock you experienced or any changes it brought to you! Here are the rules and rewards ï‘‡ ##You can choose between leaving a short comment or making a longer post.Dealineï¼šFeb 10, 2019 ## â­ RULES â­ ##1). LEAVE A COMMENT Leave a comment to my post, comparing 2 cultures you experieced in a certain aspect in any form (e.g. you can post photos that present different cultures like my 2 photos in this post, or write up a few lines, or whatever you feel likeâ€¦). No requirement of the word count / number of images or length of the audio/video. Tag one or more friends to join. Rewards: After the deadline, I will select some commenters who will share a prize of 10 Steem. OR ##2). MAKE A POST Post with @Partiko app. If you havenâ€™t used this cool mobile app, download here to give it a try! They donâ€™t take any cut from your post payout, so you have nothing to lose but a chance to get more rewards. If you have a lot of content, you can also edit it on your laptop and paste it into Partiko afterwards. ~ At least 200 words in English + 1 original image by you (can be your photo, drawing, design, etcâ€¦.);~ Or if you choose to post video or audio, it should be at least 1 minute long. Include â€œCross-culture Challenge by @itchyfeetdonicaâ€ in your post title and use â€œcross-cultureâ€ as 1 of the tags, so I can find your post. Drop your post link at the comment section of my post. Resteem this post, so more people can join the challenge (I appreciate your follow or upvote, but itâ€™s not a must). Rewards: 1st Prize * 1 winner â¬… 10 Steem + 1000 Partiko points ï¼ˆ7 Steem from me + 3 Steem from Partikoï¼‰2nd Prize * 2 winners â¬… 6 Steem + 800 Partiko points for each ï¼ˆ8 Steem from me + 4 Steem from Partikoï¼‰3rd Prize * 5 winners â¬… 3 Steem + 500 Partiko points for eachï¼ˆ10 Steem from me + 5 Steem from Partikoï¼‰ https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmP2ipXHywEjE8GcZq8izeNzkYqMaJZ8jYa4eEmkYYRHez/Partiko%20ending.png â­ â­ â­Anyone is welcome to join! Feel free to enter the challenge, or mention anybody that you thought could be interested.Here Iâ€™m reminding some Steemians who expressed interests: @philfreetotravel, @mrprofessor, @himalayannomad, @jenina619, @joelai, @elizacheng, @kelvinzhang, @cherryzz, @wilhb81, @alvin0617, @manoldonchevâ€¦Hope Iâ€™m not bothering you guys, Iâ€™m mentioning you just because thereâ€™s so much going on each day, I myself keep forgetting entering challenges before their deadlines. posts.text: ï‘† photo by me in La Paz, Bolivia ç…§ç‰‡æ‹äºç»åˆ©ç»´äºšé¦–éƒ½è¡—å¤´ ##Greetings everyone! This is the final call to joinã€Cross-culture Challengeã€‘. Many Steemians have entered their amazing posts or comments in the past few weeks, and you still have 4 days left to join the fun! =) The deadline for submitting your entry is the last minute of Feb 10th Brussels time zone (Central European Standard Time - GMT+1). ##Feb 7th is my birthday (already so in China but still 6 hours left here in Europe), so Iâ€™d like to talk a bit about the birthday celebrations in my home country and in a few countries I lived. The celebrations surely vary with different families or individuals even in the same country. Iâ€™m only comapring based on my personal experiences. In China, lots of young people celebrate their birthdays by eating in a restaurant and/or singing in a Karaoke with friends. While in some Western coutries, restaurants are kind of expensive and different from the numerous eateries in Asia (the same level of food quality and service you usually pay much less in China), so many of my Western friends and classmates choose to throw a party at home offering snacks and drinks. Iâ€™ve seen as well young people celebrating in fast food places like McDonaldâ€™s. Sometimes the group go to a bar or do bar hopping to keep on drinking, chatting and dancing. In Puerto Rico and other Latin parties I experienced, the drinking and dancing part takes a vital role. Many Latins seem to be born with a dancing talent, while most of my Asian friends prefer to sing in a confined Karaoke boxâ€¦ ;) While I lived in Chile and Australia, BBQ is also a popular way to celebrate birthday. In every apartment and house I rent in these 2 countries, thereâ€™s a dedicated part for BBQ, normally in the backyard of the house or on top floor of the apartment building. I really enjoyed this way of meeting up with friends too. =) ##Of course, there are also Chinese celebrating at home and Westerners getting together in restaurants, itâ€™s just I canâ€™t cover each individual case. What about you? How do you normally celebrate birthday? Tell me in the comments please! :) å„ä½æ–°å¹´å¥½~ è¿™æ˜¯æœ€åä¸€æ¬¡å¬é›†å¤§å®¶å‚åŠ ã€è·¨æ–‡åŒ–æ´»åŠ¨ã€‘ï¼è¿™äº›å¤©æœ‰å¾ˆå¤šæœ‹å‹å‚ä¸ç•™è¨€æˆ–å‘å¸–ï¼Œæ¯”è¾ƒäº†ä»–ä»¬æ‰€ç»å†æˆ–å¬é—»çš„æ–‡åŒ–å·®å¼‚ï¼Œéå¸¸æœ‰æ„æ€ã€‚å¦‚æœä½ æœ‰å…´è¶£ï¼Œè¿˜æœ‰å››å¤©æ—¶é—´å‡†å¤‡ã€‚æœ€åæœŸé™æ˜¯ä¸­æ¬§æ—¶é—´2æœˆ10å·çš„æœ€åä¸€ç§’ï¼ˆæ¯”åŒ—äº¬æ—¶é—´æ™š7å°æ—¶ï¼‰ã€‚ ##2æœˆ7å·æ˜¯æˆ‘çš„ç”Ÿæ—¥ï‚ï¼ŒåŒ—äº¬æ—¶é—´å·²ç»åˆ°äº†ï¼Œä½†æ¬§æ´²è¿™è¾¹è¿˜å·®6ä¸ªå°æ—¶ã€‚æ‰€ä»¥æˆ‘æ¥èŠèŠè‡ªå·±æ‰€ç»å†çš„å„æ–‡åŒ–ä¸­åº†ç¥ç”Ÿæ—¥çš„ä¸åŒã€‚å½“ç„¶ï¼Œåˆ«è¯´å„å›½ï¼Œå°±ç®—åŒä¸€ä¸ªåœ°æ–¹çš„ä¸åŒå®¶åº­æˆ–ä¸ªäººåº†ç¥ç”Ÿæ—¥çš„æ–¹å¼ä¹Ÿä¸ä¼šéƒ½ä¸€æ ·ã€‚æˆ‘åªèƒ½ä»ä¸ªäººçš„æœ‰é™ç»å†æ¥æ¯”è¾ƒä¸€ä¸‹å–½~ æˆ‘åœ¨ä¸­å›½å‘†è¿‡çš„åœ°æ–¹éƒ½åœ¨æ±Ÿå—ï¼Œå¾ˆå¤šå¹´è½»äººæ¯”è¾ƒå–œæ¬¢è¯·æœ‹å‹å»ä¸‹é¦†å­å¤§åƒä¸€é¡¿ï¼Œç„¶åå¯èƒ½å»å”±Kæˆ–è€…è¹¦è¿ªã€å‹é©¬è·¯ä¹‹ç±»ã€‚ è€Œè¥¿æ¬§å›½å®¶åŒç­‰çš„é¤é¦†å¤§éƒ½æ¯”è¾ƒè´µï¼Œè¿˜èƒ½å®‰é™å‡ºä¸ªé¸Ÿæ¥ï¼Œå„ç§ç¤¼ä»ªè®²ç©¶ï¼Œæœ‰ç‚¹æ‹˜è°¨ï¼Œåº†ç”Ÿä¹Ÿæ²¡ä»€ä¹ˆæ°”æ°›ï¼ˆæ‹‰ä¸å›½å®¶åˆä¸ä¸€æ ·ï¼Œå¤šæ¬¡äº²è§ä¸€æ¡ŒäººæŠŠæ•´ä¸ªé¥­åº—å˜æˆè½½æ­Œè½½èˆçš„æ¬¢ä¹æµ·æ´‹ï‰ïŠï¼‰ã€‚æ‰€ä»¥å¸¸è§åˆ°äº›å¹´è½»äººåœ¨ç±»ä¼¼éº¦å½“åŠ³è¿™æ ·çš„å¿«é¤åº—é‡Œåº†ç¥ï¼Œä¹Ÿæœ‰ä¸å°‘æœ‹å‹åœ¨å®¶åŠç”Ÿæ—¥è¶´ï¼Œå‡†å¤‡äº›é›¶é£Ÿé…’æ°´ï¼Œä¸€ç¾¤äººæˆ–ç«™æˆ–åï¼Œæˆ–ç†Ÿæˆ–ç”Ÿçš„äººç¾¤/é£Ÿç‰©ï¼Œç«¯ç€æ¯é…’æ°´ï¼Œå„ç§ç¥èŠæˆ–å°¬èŠã€‚ ç„¶ååœ¨æ³¢å¤šé»å„ç­‰å¾ˆæ‹‰ä¸çš„å›½å®¶ï¼Œç”Ÿæ—¥è¶´ä¸Šçš„å–é…’å’Œè·³èˆåˆè¢«ä¸Šå‡åˆ°äº†ä¸€ä¸ªæ–°é«˜åº¦ã€‚æ‹‰ä¸äººç§ä»¿ä½›ç”Ÿæ¥ä¸€å‰¯æ°´è›‡è…°ï¼Œå‡ å²çš„å°å­©å­è·³èˆä¹Ÿè¶…æœ‰éŸµå¾‹æ„Ÿï¼Œè€Œä¸å°‘ä¸œäºšäººä¼¼ä¹æ›´å–œæ¬¢é»˜é»˜åœ°èº²åœ¨å¡æ‹‰OKçš„åŒ…é—´é‡Œå¼•å­é«˜æ­Œï˜ƒã€‚ã€‚ã€‚ ä½åœ¨æ™ºåˆ©å’Œæ¾³æ´²æ—¶ï¼Œçƒ§çƒ¤ä¹Ÿæ˜¯å¾ˆå—æ¬¢è¿çš„åº†ç”Ÿæ–¹å¼ã€‚æ‰€æœ‰ç§Ÿä½è¿‡çš„å…¬å¯“å’Œå¹³æˆ¿é‡Œéƒ½æœ‰é…å¤‡BBQåœºåœ°å’Œå™¨æã€‚å‰è€…åœ¨å…¬å¯“æ¥¼çš„é¡¶å±‚ä¼šé…æœ‰å‡ ä¸ªçƒ¤æ¶ã€ç©ºé—´ç­‰ç»™å±…æ°‘å…±ç”¨ï¼Œåè€…ä¸€èˆ¬åœ¨åé™¢é‡Œã€‚ç¼•ç¼•è½»çƒŸä¸­ï¼Œä¸²ä¸²å°é£Ÿç¿»è½¬çƒ˜çƒ¤ç€ï¼Œä¸‰äº”å¥½å‹ï¼Œç›¸èšæ¬¢è°ˆï¼Œä¸ªäººè§‰å¾—è¿™æ¯”å–é…’åƒå†·ç›˜è¦æƒ¬æ„è®¸å¤šå’¯~ é‚£ä½ å‘¢ï¼Ÿä½ ä»¬é‚£é‡Œä¸€èˆ¬æ˜¯æ€ä¹ˆåº†ç¥ç”Ÿæ—¥çš„ï¼Ÿæ¬¢è¿ç•™è¨€å‘Šè¯‰æˆ‘~ ï˜Š ##So why a cross-culture challenge? â“ Like I said in my intro post: Iâ€™m most enthusiastic about traveling, photography, cooking, artâ€¦ I believe any traveler understands this wanderlust - you just canâ€™t have enough. By traveling far and wide, you discover new ways of living and understand other cultures to appreciate them, you constantly get inspired and would ultimately better yourself. Especially when you travel solo, you set yourself free and interact more with locals. You start to judge less and accept more.â€¦I do, like many of you foodies there, take great pleasure in eating and cooking. And I try to learn cooking from different cultures during my travels, to spice up my own experiments on food fusionâ€¦ ##There is a great variety of cultures on this planet, and each culture has its own charm. Lived across 5 continets and traveled to over 60 countries, I have been mesmerised by all the different cultures. Steemians here come from all over the world with rich cultural backgrounds. It would be fun to exchange some ideas/photos/videosâ€¦ Exchange makes change. Live and let live. So my challenge will focus on â€œcross-cultureâ€. To join this challenge, you just need to compare 2 or more cultures that you have experienced. Any form of content is welcome, you can write a short essay, post a photo story, create a drawing/painting/animation/design, share a quick video, record your voice of talking or singingâ€¦ all fine! It would be great to hear your personal stories soaking up in different cultures. Share your inspiration with us! ##Then what is culture? ï§ Back in my uni course of Cultural Studies, thereâ€™s been heated discussion about what exactly culture is. To some extent, it seems almost everything can be seen as culture. To give you a bit inspiration, hereâ€™s one of the definitions: Culture is the characteristics and knowledge of a particular group of people, encompassing language, religion, cuisine, social habits, music and arts, etc.. ##https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/itchyfeetdonica/YwGYWSTB-SingaporeKampongGlam.JPG ï‘† photo by me in Kampong Glam, Singaporeç…§ç‰‡æ‹äºæ–°åŠ å¡ ##So thatâ€™s it, just go pick a cultural topic (language, religion, cuisine, social habits, music and arts, etc..) from 2 or more particular groups of people that you are familiar with, and show the differences to us in a certain form. Inspire me and other Steemians! Tell us any culture shock you experienced or any changes it brought to you! Here are the rules and rewards ï‘‡ ##You can choose between leaving a short comment or making a longer post. Dealineï¼šLast minute of Feb 10th, Brussels time zone (Central European Standard Time - GMT+1) ## â­ RULES â­ ##1). LEAVE A COMMENT Leave a comment to my post, comparing 2 cultures you experieced in a certain aspect in any form (e.g. you can post photos that present different cultures like my 2 photos in this post, or write up a few lines, or whatever you feel likeâ€¦). No requirement of the word count / number of images or length of the audio/video. Tag one or more friends to join. Rewards: After the deadline, I will select some commenters who will share a prize of 10 Steem. OR ##2). MAKE A POST Post with @Partiko app. If you havenâ€™t used this cool mobile app, download here to give it a try! They donâ€™t take any cut from your post payout, so you have nothing to lose but a chance to get more rewards. If you have a lot of content, you can also edit it on your laptop and paste it into Partiko afterwards. ~ At least 200 words in English + 1 original image by you (can be your photo, drawing, design, etcâ€¦.);~ Or if you choose to post video or audio, it should be at least 1 minute long. Include â€œCross-culture Challenge by @itchyfeetdonicaâ€ in your post title and use â€œcross-cultureâ€ as 1 of the tags, so I can find your post. Drop your post link at the comment section of my post. Resteem this post, so more people can join the challenge (I appreciate your follow or upvote, but itâ€™s not a must). Rewards: 1st Prize * 1 winner â¬… 10 Steem + 1000 Partiko points ï¼ˆ7 Steem from me + 3 Steem from Partikoï¼‰2nd Prize * 2 winners â¬… 6 Steem + 800 Partiko points for each ï¼ˆ8 Steem from me + 4 Steem from Partikoï¼‰3rd Prize * 5 winners â¬… 3 Steem + 500 Partiko points for eachï¼ˆ10 Steem from me + 5 Steem from Partikoï¼‰ https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmP2ipXHywEjE8GcZq8izeNzkYqMaJZ8jYa4eEmkYYRHez/Partiko%20ending.png â­ â­ â­Anyone is welcome to join! posts.title: #182 Best Wishes from Sardinia ğŸŒŠ ğŸ¤— | æ¥è‡ªæ’’ä¸å²›çš„é—®å€™
posts.text: Hey my friends! Today is the first day of Chinese Spring Festival. So Happy New Year to all who celebrate this! ï‰ïˆïŠï—ï—ï—ï²ï›ï¥˜ï¤ï¤ï¤ï¥‚ï¾ï¥¢ Iâ€™m in Sardinia of Italy and sharing a photo right from yesterday. :) It was close to Alghero at the islandâ€™s northwestern coast. Itâ€™s raining, raining and raining most of the time. The dark clouds were hanging low, and the strong waves crushed onto the rocky shores in the crazy heavy wind. Used to the clear tranquil water of the Mediterranean Sea, this turbulent scene was quite unexpected. ##å¤§å®¶æ–°å¹´å¥½ï¼ï‰ïˆ çŒ®ä¸Šæ¥è‡ªæ„å¤§åˆ©æ’’ä¸å²›çš„æ±¹æ¶Œç¥ç¦ï½ ç¥ï·å¹´åƒé¥±ç¡å¥½æ²¡çƒ¦æ¼ï¼ Chinese New Year and Spring Festival##In China, most working people will have a week holiday around the New Year, starting from New Yearâ€™s Eve or a bit earlier. This holiday is normally called Golden Week Holiday of Spring Festival. Just like the Christmas holiday for westerners, Spring Festival is of great importance for Chinese family reunions. So why does the 2019 Chinese New Year land on February 5th instead of January 1st? It is because the Spring Festival in China is based on the lunar calendar, which is decided by the monthly cycles of the Moonâ€™s phases, also known as synodic months. As a result, the Chinese New Year has no exact date each year, but it mostly falls on a day in January or February in Gregorian calendar, roughly the same dates of Aquarius sign in the Western Zodiac. Actually, thereâ€™s also a Chinese Valentineâ€™s Day(Qixi/Qiqiao Festival) originated from a beautiful romantic legend, which falls on the 7th day of the 7th month on the Chinese lunar calendar, so itâ€™s usually some day in July or August in Gregorian Calendar. And a fun fact: my birthday is February 7th, which always fell somewhere close to the Chinese New Year. :) As you may know, 2019 is the year of Pig. If you are interested in the Chinese Zodiac culture, check out this post I did last year. =) ##Last year I was in Australia during the Spring Festival, also by the sea. Here are the greeting cards I made from the photo I took of The Twelve Apostles: æƒ³èµ·å»å¹´æ­¤æ—¶åœ¨æ¾³æ´²è¿‡æ˜¥èŠ‚ï¼Œä¹Ÿæ˜¯åœ¨æµ·è¾¹ï¼Œæ‹äº†å¤§æ´‹è·¯ä¸Šæœ‰åçš„12é—¨å¾’å²©(å…¶å®åªå‰©8ä¸ª;p)åšæˆè´ºå¡ï¼š ## ## ## This is also my entry to the Photo Friday competition by @qurator. posts.title: #184 Traveling by Train ğŸš† | ç«è½¦æ—…è¡Œ
posts.text: ##How are you doing fellow Steemians? Today is my birthday! ï˜ƒ Itâ€™s irrelevant to this post though. ;) Iâ€™m going for dinner after this and will possibly post about the food another day if I donâ€™t get too lazy. The head image is my entry for the #TravelPhotoContest by @lightcaptured. The theme of this week is Black & White. I shot this photo from a train when traveling through Tea Country in central Sri Lanka. ïš‚ It was raining harder and harder. I sticked my head out the window and saw another traveler hanging out in the rain. The view looked pretty cool, so I captured that moment. When you visit Sri Lanka, taking the trains ïšŠ is definitely something you shouldnâ€™t miss. Itâ€™s an inexpensive way to get around, and the trains are going through beautiful scenic area, packed with fun cultural experiences as well. ##The initial railway system was built by the British in 1864, mainly to transport tea and coffee from the Tea Country to the capital port city Colombo, so that the produce can be shipped internationally. Today there are train tracks between major towns in Sri Lanka. The coastal train ride from Colombo to Dutch colonial Galle is also popular among tourists and locals alike. In the following photo I took at the Marine Drive of Colombo, you can see the train rails. This running train was probably going to Galle or somewhere in between along the coast. https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmdRtTHfSz2PmHEQtrnnfG28CABMiQSQnL5Efdz6QoM1mF/sritraincolombobw.JPG The black & white photos are also my entries to @daveksâ€™ #bwphotocontest themed â€œPlanes, Trains and Automobilesâ€. The photos in color are my entries to the Photo Friday competition by @qurator. Check out all these photo contests and join the fun! :) ##å—¨~ ä»Šå¤©æ˜¯æˆ‘ç”Ÿæ—¥ï¼Œï˜ƒ å»åƒæ™šé¥­å‰æ¥å‘ä¸¤å¼ åœ¨æ–¯é‡Œå…°å¡æ‹çš„ç…§ç‰‡ï¼Œå‚åŠ æœºè½¦/æ—…æ¸¸ä¸ºä¸»é¢˜çš„é»‘ç™½æ‘„å½±æ´»åŠ¨ã€‚ä»¥å‰è¯´è¿‡æ–¯é‡Œå…°å¡æ˜¯æˆ‘æœ€å–œæ¬¢çš„æ—…è¡Œç›®çš„åœ°ä¹‹ä¸€ï¼Œæ˜¯å°‘æ•°å‡ ä¸ªå»è¿‡è¿˜æƒ³å†å»çš„åœ°æ–¹ã€‚ç‹¬è‡ªåœ¨é‚£é‡Œæ™ƒè¡äº†å‡ å‘¨ï¼Œç®€ç›´ä¹ä¸æ€èœ€ã€‚ç•™ä¸‹çš„ç²—æµ…å°è±¡ï¼šè‡ªç„¶é£å…‰ç§€ç¾ï¼Œå†å²æ–‡åŒ–ç¿çƒ‚ï¼Œé£Ÿç‰©ç¾å‘³å¥åº·ï¼Œäººæ°‘å’Œå–„å‹å¥½ã€‚ å¦‚æœä½ å»æ–¯é‡Œå…°å¡ï¼Œè®°å¾—è¯•è¯•ä¹˜ç«è½¦æ—…è¡Œã€‚ç«è½¦ä¸ä»…æ˜¯å½“åœ°äººå¸¸ç”¨çš„ä¾¿å®œäº¤é€šå·¥å…·ï¼Œæ²¿é€”ç»è¿‡çš„åœ°æ–¹ä¹Ÿå¤„å¤„æ˜¯ç¾æ™¯ã€‚æœ€åˆçš„åˆ—è½¦ç³»ç»Ÿæ˜¯ç”±è‹±å›½æ®–æ°‘æ”¿åºœåœ¨1864å¹´ä¿®å»ºçš„ï¼Œä¸»è¦ä¸ºäº†æŠŠå±±åŒºäº§çš„èŒ¶å¶å’Œå’–å•¡è¿å¾€é¦–éƒ½ç§‘ä¼¦å¡çš„æ¸¯å£ï¼Œå†èˆ¹è¿å‡ºå»ã€‚å¦‚ä»Šï¼Œæ–¯é‡Œå…°å¡çš„ä¸»è¦åŸé•‡ä¹‹é—´ä¹Ÿéƒ½æœ‰ç«è½¦çº¿è·¯è¿æ¥ã€‚ ç¬¬ä¸€å¼ æ˜¯åœ¨ä¸­éƒ¨çš„èŒ¶å¶äº§åŒºï¼Œæˆ‘ååœ¨æ™ƒæ‚ æ‚ çš„ç ´æ—§è“çš®ç«è½¦ä¸Šïš†ï¼Œä¸€è·¯è¿¤é€¦ç©¿è¡Œäºè‹ç¿ çš„ç¾¤å±±ï¼Œç§€ç¾çš„èŒ¶å›­é£å…‰å°½æ”¶çœ¼åº•ã€‚å±±åŒºæ°”å€™å¤šå˜ï¼Œæ—¶æ™´ïŒ¤æ—¶é›¨ïŒ§ï¼Œé£æ™¯ä¹Ÿå› æ­¤å˜å¹»ã€‚æ‹è¿™å¼ ç…§ç‰‡çš„æ—¶å€™ï¼Œé›¨åŠ¿æ¸æ¶¨ï¼Œçª—å¤–å¼€å§‹æœ¦èƒ§èµ·æ¥ï¼Œå¤§èŠ­è•‰å¶è¢«é›¨æ°´æ‹æ‰“åœ°ç¨€é‡Œå“—å•¦~ æˆ‘æŠŠå¤´ä¼¸å‡ºå»ï¼Œæ­£å¥½çœ‹åˆ°å¦å¤–ä¸€èŠ‚è½¦å¢çš„ä¸€åæ¸¸å®¢æ‹‰ç€æ‰¶æ‰‹ï¼ŒæŒ‚åœ¨å¤–é¢ï¼Œè“è¡£è“åŒ…è·Ÿç«è½¦è¿˜æŒºæ­ï¼Œå°±å’”åš“ä¸‹äº†è¿™ä¸ªç¬é—´ã€‚ ç¬¬äºŒå¼ ç…§ç‰‡æ‹äºé¦–éƒ½ç§‘ä¼¦å¡å¸‚å—éƒŠçš„æ»¨æµ·é“ä¸Šï¼Œè¿™å¥”é©°çš„ç«è½¦åº”è¯¥æ˜¯å¼€å¾€å—éƒ¨çš„æŸä¸ªåœ°æ–¹ã€‚ä»¥å‰ä¹Ÿå‘è¿‡äº›æ ‘å½±å©†å¨‘çš„ï¼Œè¿˜å†™äº†å‡ å¥ç…½æƒ…çš„è¯çœ‹ä¸Šå»æ„Ÿè§‰è‡ªå·±æ˜¯å…°å¡æ—…æ¸¸å±€æ´¾æ¥å®‰åˆ©çš„è½¯æ–‡å†™æ‰‹ï¼Œç„¶é¹…æ­¤åˆ»çš„æˆ‘ä¸€å¿ƒæƒ³ç€å»åƒé¥­ï—ï¼Œåªèƒ½æŠ„è¢­ä¸€ä¸‹ä¹‹å‰å†™çš„ï¼š ä»é¦–éƒ½ç§‘ä¼¦å¡å¼€å¾€å—éƒ¨æµ·æ»¨çš„è·å…°æ®–æ°‘å¤åŸåŠ å‹’çš„è¿™æ¡æ²¿æµ·ç«è½¦çº¿è·¯ä¹Ÿå¾ˆå—æ¸¸å®¢æ¬¢è¿ã€‚ä¸€è¾¹æ˜¯è”šè“å¹¿é˜”çš„å°åº¦æ´‹ï¼Œä¸€è¾¹æ˜¯å—äºšé£æƒ…çš„å¸‚äº•ç™¾æ€ï¼Œè¿˜ä¸æ—¶ç‚¹ç¼€ç€èŒ‚ç››è‘±èŒçš„çƒ­å¸¦æ¤ç‰©ï¼Œæ— æ•Œæµ·æ™¯é…ä¸Šæ‘‡æ›³å¤šå§¿çš„æ£•æ¦ˆæ ‘ï¼Œçœ‹å¤•é˜³ç¼“ç¼“ä¸‹è½ï¼Œè¿˜éœ€è¦æˆ‘ç»§ç»­å®‰åˆ©å—ï¼Ÿ;) ##Do you like traveling by train? posts.title: #186 Getting To Know Each Other / Another 10 Random Questions Challenge ğŸ’­| 10ä¸ªé—®é¢˜æŒ‘æˆ˜
posts.text: Greetings everyone! ï‘‹ In your travels, have you seen unforgettable views from an airplane window? The photo here was taken by me when flying from Puerto Montt to Punta Arenas in southern Chile. From the Atacama in the North to the Patagonia in the South, Chile is a fascinating country with so much to offer. ï˜ Iâ€™ve shared some pictures and experiences from Atacama and Patagonia before, and this is the first time I post a photo of this region. Itâ€™s known for its breathtaking volcanoes and lakes. The view from the sky looks quite spectacular right? This is also my entry for the Photo Friday competition by @qurator. https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmdUCEFEMWrjkm1TWqw5DuTvH4bBJKNtcCaoQU3U9SLCjd/PmonttPunAre.JPG ##A loooooooog long time ago, @jenina619 nominated me to do the Getting To Know Each Other / Another 10 Random Questions Challenge (because apparently last year thereâ€™s a â€œ10 Random Questions Challengeâ€ ï™‚). I found itâ€™s fun and got to know some Steem friends better after reading their answers. Earlier today I watched the challenge video of @livinguktaiwan, and realized I still havenâ€™t joined it! So here it is: ##1. What supernatural power would you want to have? Be able to fly and to turn objects edible. ï•Šï— ##2. If you could choose your birth place, where will it be, and why? Mars. They say â€œMen Are from Mars, Women Are from Venusâ€, so Iâ€™d like to try out a different world. ïš€ïŒŒ ##3. If you could go back in time to meet someone from the past, who will it be and why? Leonardo da Vinci. Heâ€™s a cool combination of scientist and artist. I have to learn some ancient Italian first though. ï”¬ï¨ ##4. Which childhood memory is your favorite? Found lots of money notes rolled in a tin can hidden in a tree hole when playing with my cousin. We bought a hill of snacks with that money. ï’´ï¨ ##5. What are the three things you notice in the opposite sex first? eyes, nose and mouth (if we are sitting)nosetril, chin and beard (if we are standing)hair, hands and shoes (the more sensual movielike ostentatious answer) ##6. If Life was a music, what song will yours be playing ? Bobby McFerrin - Donâ€™t Worry Be Happy ï·ï’ƒhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d-diB65scQU ##7. If you were arrested with no explanation, what would your friends and family assume you had done? Ate too much in a restaurant and forgot to bring cash/card/Wechat/Alipay with me. Or some powerful official was offended by my bad joke. ##8. In one sentence, how would you sum up the whaleshares platform? Good marketing if you guys created this challenge. ;) Seriously, I canâ€™t even find enough time for this platform, not to say a 2nd one. Anyone who tried it out? Iâ€™d love to see your answers! ##9. Whatâ€™s the funniest Wi-Fi name youâ€™ve seen? 123abc ##10. Whatâ€™s something your brain tries to make you do and you have to will yourself not to do it? Sleeping in the morning. And now time to nominate some Steemians to join the challenge! ï˜ƒ Some active friends from greater CN community who post also in English:@joythewanderer @deanliu @catwomanteresa @ace108 @susanlo @htliao @sasaadrian @magicmonk @honoru @ericet @crypto.talk @wilhb81 @elizacheng @davidke20 @kimzwarch @auleo @fruityexplorerâ€¦ This photo + music video combination reminds me of the good old @Photogames buddies:@derekkind @jarvie @sjarvie5 @scottshots @r00sj3 @soyrosa @bil.prag @derangedvisions @fotostefâ€¦ Teammates from @Steemitworldmap:@martibis @lizanomadsoul @choogirl(I know you are almost quitting, but I hope to see your shit fun answers. ;) ) Teammates from @utopian-io & @davinci.witness CN translation:@sunray @aafeng @victory622 @aaronliâ€¦ Cool Steemians from everywhere (mainly Travel/Photography/DTube communities it seemsâ€¦ I confess I havenâ€™t been so active like in the beginning, should post and get around much more):@world-travel-pro @runicar @nomadicsoul @liltammy @phortun @truestories @boxcarblue @rt395 @yo-yo @jrvacation @jpphotography @for91days @mrprofessor @betterthanhome @delishtreats @nathanmars @adetorrent @waybeyondpadthai @daveonarrival @philfreetotravel @chireerocks @melinda010100 @trudeehunter @dswigle @joanstewart @lightcaptured @worldcaptureâ€¦ The list goes on and on and onâ€¦ Here are just some (still active) Steemians I could think of right now, anyone I missed feel free to join too! Hope to see your answers ~ letâ€™s get to know each other a bit better! =) ## â­ AD TIME â­ Welcome to join my Cross-culture Challenge! The deadline is coming soon~ Thank you for visiting! Please tell me what you think. Exchange makes change!If you like my content, please support me by commenting / following / upvoting / resteeming. æ„Ÿè°¢æ¥è®¿ï¼ä½ çš„å…³æ³¨/ç‚¹èµ/ç•™è¨€/è½¬å‘å°±æ˜¯å¯¹æˆ‘æœ€å¥½çš„æ”¯æŒ~ ä¸‹æ¬¡è§ï¼ ##Here are some of my travel shots. Check out my posts on Steemit World Map, and follow me for more adventures around the globe! ä¸‹é¢æ˜¯æˆ‘çš„ä¸€äº›æ—…é€”æ‘„å½±ã€‚æ¬¢è¿æŸ¥çœ‹æˆ‘çš„Steemitä¸–ç•Œåœ°å›¾ï¼Œè·Ÿæˆ‘ä¸€èµ·ç¯æ¸¸ä¸–ç•Œ~ï¼ https://steemitimages.com/DQmWSyM6PcNQJ9LL5UciWHWdZjHvcKQwP63HHMyJzvzvobB/4.jpg This page is synchronized from the post: â€˜#186 Getting To Know Each Other / Another 10 Random Questions Challenge ï’­| 10ä¸ªé—®é¢˜æŒ‘æˆ˜â€™ document.querySelectorAll('.not-gallery-item') .forEach(el => { if (!el.dataset.src) { return; } const img = document.createElement('img'); img.style = 'display:none !important;'; img.src = el.dataset.src; img.addEventListener('error', () => { img.remove(); el.style.color = 'inherit'; el.style.backgroundImage = 'none'; el.style.background = 'none'; }); img.addEventListener('load', () => { img.remove(); }); document.body.appendChild(img); });

posts.title: #187 DIY Red Packet âœ‚ğŸ–Œ | ğŸ·è‡ªåˆ¶çŒªå¹´çº¢åŒ…
posts.text: ##Hey, whatâ€™s up my friends! As you may know, people in China and ethnic Chinese around the world have been celebrating the New Year of the Pig since a few days ago. To go with the flow and to join @christinelookâ€™s contest of presenting red packets, I just made a red packet from scratch. (Thanks @fruityexplorer and @jenina619 for tagging me! =)) And itâ€™s definitely part of my #beautifulsunday (by @ace108) and #sublimesunday (by @c0ff33a)! :) ##ä»Šå¤©æ˜¯åˆå…­ï¼Œå¤§å®¶ç»§ç»­æ–°å¹´å¥½ï¼ï‰ æ„Ÿè°¢@fruityexplorerå’Œ@jenina619æé†’æˆ‘å‚åŠ @christinelookçš„æ™’çº¢åŒ…æ´»åŠ¨ã€‚å› ä¸ºå·²ç»é•¿å¤§å¥½å¤šå¹´ï¼Œæ²¡æœ‰çº¢åŒ…æ‹¿ï¼Œè¿™é‡Œä¹Ÿä¸åƒå·´é»ä¼¦æ•¦æ—§é‡‘å±±æ¸©å“¥åä¹‹ç±»çš„åŸå¸‚æœ‰é‚£ä¹ˆå¤šåäººï¼Œæ²¡ä»€ä¹ˆè¿‡å¹´æ°”æ°›ã€‚æ‰€ä»¥æˆ‘å°±è‡ªå·±æ¥åšä¸€ä¸ªçº¢åŒ…å§ï¼ è¯·çœ‹å…·ä½“æ­¥éª¤ï¼š ##Hereâ€™s the breakdown: ##Prepare a piece of red cardstock:è£ä¸€å¼ çº¢è‰²è–„å¡çº¸ï¼š ##Cut it out, fold and glue it into a packet:å‰ªã€æŠ˜ã€å›ºä½“èƒ¶ç²˜åˆï¼š ##Since itâ€™s the Pig Year, I draw a cartoon pig face at the back and cut the shape out:èƒŒé¢å°å£ç”»ä¸ŠçŒªå¤´ï¼ŒæŒ‰å¤–å½¢å‰ªä¸€ä¸‹ï¼š ##I write down the Chinese character of SPRING in front with a typical brush for calligraphy, but I donâ€™t have Chinese ink at home, so I use the black metallic paint instead. Itâ€™s not as smooth, but itâ€™s shining which is pretty cool and festive. :) I feel this type of paint is suitable for making greeting cards (like what I did when DIYing the Christmas card), and red packets are similar to greeting cards in terms of their function and medium, arenâ€™t they? ##æˆ‘å°æ‰‹ä¸€æŒ¥ï¼Œåœ¨çº¢åŒ…æ­£é¢å†™ä¸‹ä¸ªâ€œæ˜¥â€å­—ï¼Œå› ä¸ºæ˜¥èŠ‚ã€æ˜¥å›å¤§åœ°å˜›ï¼Œæ€»ä¸èƒ½å†™ä¸ªâ€œçŒªâ€ï–å­—å§~ ï˜ƒ å› ä¸ºå®¶é‡Œæ²¡æœ‰å¢¨æ°´ï¼Œå°±ç”¨é»‘è‰²é—ªå…‰æ¶‚æ–™ä»£æ›¿äº†ã€‚è™½ç„¶æ²¡é‚£ä¹ˆä¸æ»‘å¥½è¿ç¬”ï¼Œæ¯”è¾ƒå¹²æ¶©ï¼Œä½†æœ‰ä¸€ç§bling blingçš„æ•ˆæœï¼Œç®€ç›´äº®ççœ¼~ æƒ³æƒ³ä¸Šæ¬¡DIYåœ£è¯è´ºå¡ä¹Ÿæ˜¯ç”¨çš„è¿™ç§æ¶‚æ–™ï¼Œåæ­£çº¢åŒ…å’Œè´ºå¡ä¸æ˜¯å·®ä¸å¤šçš„ä¸œè¥¿å—ï¼Ÿä¸€ä¸ªä¾›å†™å­—ï¼Œä¸€ä¸ªä¾›è£…é’±+å†™å­—ã€‚ã€‚ã€‚ æ­£é¢æ²¡å†™â€œçŒªâ€ï¼Œé‚£åé¢ç”»åªçŒªå¤´ï·å¥½äº†ã€‚æˆ‘çœ‹ç€çŒªé¼»å­çªå‡ºçš„åœ°æ–¹ï¼Œçªç„¶æƒ³åˆ°ä¸ªä¸é”™çš„åŠæ³•ã€‚å°±æ˜¯ç”¨åˆ€ï”ªåœ¨ä¸‹é¢çš„çº¸ä¸Šåˆ»ä¸€æ¡ç¼ï¼Œè¿™æ ·æŠŠçŒªé¼»å­æ’è¿›å»å°±ç®—ç»™çº¢åŒ…å°å£äº†ã€‚ä½†æ˜¯é¼»å­è¿›å»åï¼Œä¼šæœ‰ä¸€æˆªè¢«çº¢çº¸æŒ¡ä½ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥æˆ‘åˆæ²¿ç€é‚£é“å¼§çº¿ç”»äº†å¼ å˜´ï¼Œè¿™æ ·ä¸ç®¡æ’ä¸æ’å…¥ï¼Œçœ‹ç€éƒ½ä¸ä¼šå¥‡æ€ªã€‚æˆ‘æ˜¯ä¸æ˜¯æœ‰ç‚¹æœºæ™ºï¼Ÿï˜† ##Make a cut for the â€œpig noseâ€ to get in, so the packet can be sealed after the bank notes are put in: ## ##Thatâ€™s it! ï˜Šå®Œæˆï¼ ##What do you think of my handmade red packet? posts.title: #189 Roses ğŸŒ¹ | èŠ± My Entry for the VALENTINE'S DAY PHOTO CONTEST 2019 by @flamingirl
posts.text: ##Red roses are a widely known symbol of love, passion and courage, so they are popular gifts for Valentineâ€™s Day, like the ones I got here. This is my entry for the VALENTINEâ€™S DAY PHOTO CONTEST 2019 by @flamingirl. I post 3 photos from different angles as proof that they are my photoworks. More details can be provided if necessary. ## ##Hereâ€™s a bit history and legend about roses. Earliest roses are known to have grown 35 million-years ago, and from ancient Egyptian tombs, petrified rose wreaths have been unearthed. In Greek mythology, Aphrodite, Goddess of Love, is said to have created the rose. According to the poet Anacreon, sea foam dripping from her newborn body turned into white roses; thus symbolizing her innocence and purity. Later, her wounded lover Adonisâ€™ blood was shed onto a white rose, and the red rose represented her desire and passion. The Romans, with their counterpart Goddess of Love - Venus, also adopted the rose as a symbol of love and beauty. Cupid offered a rose to bribe the God of Silence to hush his mother Venusâ€™s affairs. And when he shot arrows at bees which had stung him, thorns grew from the rose stems where the bees were missed. Thereâ€™s even The War of the Roses. In this civil war in England in the 15th century, the House of York adopted a white rose, while the House of Lancaster chose a red rose. At last, the winner - Tudor Henry VII created the Tudor Rose by merging his Lancastrian rose with the red rose of his York bride. This Rose is also known as the Rose of England. ##My previous photos of roses: https://steemitimages.com/DQmUyKXEpGvGVtM2KGEeoMFvwf4LJM5ugPcxhbGGxLxQ1pB/IMG_7777rose.JPGhttps://steemitimages.com/0x0/https://steemitimages.com/DQmShi8x6o3ZiBCohGF32XLJpQA5YdJ4Qj3YGuL8HLQ2AwS/106177A4-551D-4EE2-BD51-DE4A2FE09931.jpeg ##å¼ çˆ±ç²å¥¶å¥¶70å¤šå¹´å‰åœ¨å¥¹çš„å°è¯´ã€Šçº¢ç«ç‘°ä¸ç™½ç«ç‘°ã€‹ä¸­ç•™ä¸‹äº†è¿™æ®µåè¨€ï¼š ä¹Ÿè®¸æ¯ä¸€ä¸ªç”·å­å…¨éƒ½æœ‰è¿‡è¿™æ ·çš„ä¸¤ä¸ªå¥³äººï¼Œè‡³å°‘ä¸¤ä¸ªã€‚å¨¶äº†çº¢ç«ç‘°ï¼Œä¹…è€Œä¹…ä¹‹ï¼Œçº¢çš„å˜äº†å¢™ä¸Šçš„ä¸€æŠ¹èšŠå­è¡€ï¼Œç™½çš„è¿˜æ˜¯â€œåºŠå‰æ˜æœˆå…‰â€ã€‚å¨¶äº†ç™½ç«ç‘°ï¼Œç™½çš„ä¾¿æ˜¯è¡£æœä¸Šæ²¾çš„ä¸€ç²’é¥­é»å­ï¼Œçº¢çš„å´æ˜¯å¿ƒå£ä¸Šä¸€é¢—æœ±ç ‚ç—£ã€‚ å°è¯´é‡Œï¼Œçƒ­çƒˆçš„çº¢ç«ç‘°æœ€ç»ˆè½¬å˜ä¸ºè´¤æ…§çš„ä»–äººå¦»ï¼Œåœ£æ´çš„ç™½ç«ç‘°å´è‹å‡‰åœ°å¤±å»äº†è‡ªæˆ‘ã€‚å“ªä¸ªæ›´å¥½ï¼Ÿå“ªä¸ªæ›´åˆé€‚ï¼Ÿä½•æ­¢å©šå§»æ˜¯å›´åŸï¼Œè¿™ä¸–ä¸Šåˆæœ‰ä»€ä¹ˆé‡å¤§å†³å®šä¸æ˜¯å‘¢ï¼Ÿ All content by @itchyfeetdonicaå›¾æ–‡ by Donicaå¤š Thank you for visiting! posts.text: ##Unlike most travelers going by land transportation, I reached Torres del Paine National Park in the Chilean part by boat through Rio Serrano. :) And it proved to be a great choice. After some hiking, I was stunned by this view at sunset - five elegant guanacos grazing at the altiplano steppe, with the magnificent snow mountains as the backdrop. These camelids are native to South America, closely related to their more famous cousin - llama. =) I also felt lucky to have visited Patagonia during autumn time, as the landscape in the warm tone was surely a feast to eyes! ##åèˆ¹åˆ°è¾¾æ™ºåˆ©å—éƒ¨çš„ç™¾å†…å›½å®¶å…¬å›­åï¼Œå¾’æ­¥äº†ä¸€æˆªï¼Œå°±è§åˆ°è¿™ç•ªç¾æ™¯ã€‚å¤•é˜³è¥¿ä¸‹ï¼Œå‡ åŒ¹éª†é©¬ï¼ˆç›¸å½“äºè‰æ³¥é©¬çš„è¡¨å¼Ÿï¼‰åœ¨æ‚ é—²åœ°åƒç€è‰ï¼ŒèƒŒåçš„é›ªå±±é™é™çŸ—ç«‹ï¼Œé‚£ç§ä¸–å¤–æ¡ƒæºèˆ¬çš„ç»å¦™æ™¯è‰²ï¼Œå¾ˆéš¾ç”¨è¯­è¨€å½¢å®¹ã€‚å¹¸å¥½æ‹ä¸‹è¿™å¼ ç…§ç‰‡ï¼Œçœå¾—æˆ‘æœè‚ åˆ®è‚šæ¥æç»˜ã€‚ã€‚ã€‚=) é€‰åœ¨ç§‹å¤©å»é‚£è¾¹ä¹Ÿå¾ˆæ˜æ™ºï¼Œæ¼«å±±éé‡çš„æš–è‰²è°ƒï¼Œç¾ä¸èƒœæ”¶ã€‚ All content by @itchyfeetdonicaå›¾æ–‡ by Donicaå¤š Thank you for visiting! posts.text: ##Greetings everyone! Today Iâ€™m sharing my experience of visiting a textile market in the Sacred Valley, Peru. posts.title: #192 STEEM Food Tours #49 A Szechuan Restaurant in Belgium ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡³ğŸ²ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡ª | æ¯”åˆ©æ—¶æ­£å®—å·èœé¦†æ¨è
posts.text: Hi everyone, in this review Iâ€™m sharing my food experience in a wonderful Szechuan restaurant in Belgium. :) Itâ€™s opened last year, and it immediately became my favorite Chinese restaurant in this region after I first tried it out. So I went there recently again and again, on my birthday and on Valentineâ€™s Day too! =) ä»Šå¤©æ¨èä¸€å®¶æ¯”åˆ©æ—¶å»å¹´æ–°å¼€çš„å·èœé¦†ï¼Œè‡ªä»å‘ç°è¿™ä¸ªè¶…èµçš„åœ°æ–¹ï¼Œå‡ ä¹æ¯å‘¨éƒ½è¦å»ä¸€æ¬¡ï¼Œå‰äº›å¤©ç”Ÿæ—¥åˆå»åƒäº†ï¼Œæƒ…äººèŠ‚åˆåŒå»åƒäº†ï¼Œä»Šå¤©åˆåŒå’å»åƒäº†ã€‚ã€‚ã€‚:D ## ##Szechuan (â€œSichuanâ€ in Mandarin Pinyin) cuisine originates from Sichuan Province of Southwest China. Itâ€™s known for its bold pungent spicy flavours, resulting from liberal use of garlic and chili peppers, as well as the numb-your-tongue Sichuan peppercorn (Huajiao) ;). Since most early Chinese immigrants overseas are from the coastal provinces like Canton and Fujian, a large amount of old Chinese restaurants out of China serve dishes from these parts. A few of them are genuine with subtle flavors, most are westernized usually with sweet and sour sauce or covered by soy sauce, which is pretty strange to the Chinese eaters. Iâ€™ve probably explained 1000 times to my international friends that Cantonese cuisine is only a small part of Chinese cuisine, and even much of the Cantonese cuisine we get out of China is not so authentic. ;) So when I discovered this Sichuan restaurant in a small town in Belgium, I felt exhilarated. Yes, the immense joy of devouring genuine tasty Chinese food! :D å·èœå¤§å®¶å¯èƒ½éƒ½ç†Ÿæ‚‰ï¼Œå¤šå¹´å‰å°±å·²ç»ç«éå…¨å›½ï¼Œåœ¨æµ·å¤–åäººèšå±…åŒºä¹Ÿä¸éš¾çœ‹åˆ°ï¼Œåªæ˜¯åœ¨æ¯”åˆ©æ—¶è¿™æ ·çš„å°åœ°æ–¹å¹¶ä¸å¸¸è§ã€‚å› ä¸ºæ—©æœŸçš„è€ç§»æ°‘é¤é¦†å¤šä¸ºè¿åˆè¥¿æ–¹å£å‘³æ”¹è‰¯çš„éæ­£å®—ç²¤èœï¼Œè€ŒçœŸæ­£èƒ½åšå‡ºç²¤èœé²œé¦™çˆ½æ»‘å«©å£å‘³çš„ä¸å¤šï¼Œé€ æˆå¾ˆå¤šæ²¡å»è¿‡ä¸­å›½çš„å›½é™…å‹äººçš„è¯¯è§£ï¼Œè¯´åˆ°ä¸­å›½èœï¼Œå°±ä»¥ä¸ºæ˜¯é‚£ç§ç±»ä¼¼å’•å™œè‚‰çš„é…¸ç”œç³»ï¼Œæˆ–è€…é…±æ²¹åŒ…æ½ä¸€åˆ‡çš„ä¸€å›¢å¯æ€•é»‘ç³Šã€‚ã€‚ã€‚>_< æˆ‘åœ¨ä¸–ç•Œå„åœ°è¢«åæ§½å¤šæ¬¡ï¼Œæ¯æ¬¡éƒ½è¦è‹¦å£å©†å¿ƒè§£é‡Šä¸€ç•ªã€‚åˆ«è¯´ä¸­å›½è¿™ä¹ˆå¤šä¸åŒçš„èœç³»ï¼Œåªæ˜¯å…¶ä¸­çš„ç²¤èœå°±åŒ…æ‹¬å¹¿å·èœã€æ½®å·èœã€ä¸œæ±Ÿèœ/æ¢…å·èœè¿™äº›ä¸åŒçš„åœ°æ–¹é£å‘³ï¼Œä¸»æ–™ä¹‹å¹¿æ³›ä¸°å¯Œã€é…æ–™ä¹‹ç²¾ç»†è®²ç©¶ï¼Œå‡ å¤©å‡ å¤œéƒ½è®²ä¸å®Œå•Šã€‚è¿˜å¥½å»å¹´æ–°å¼€äº†ä¸€å®¶â€œå½“ä»£â€é£æ ¼çš„å·èœé¦†ï¼Œé™¤äº†é²œé¦™éº»è¾£çš„å·èœï¼Œä¹Ÿç…§é¡¾åˆ°å½“åœ°äººçš„å£å‘³ï¼Œæœ‰åŒ—äº¬çƒ¤é¸­ã€å¹¿å¼æ—¥å¼éŸ©å¼çš„ä¸€äº›èœå“å’Œå°ç‚¹å¿ƒï¼Œå¾ˆæ£’ï¼Œå¯ä»¥å¸¸å»è§£è§£é¦‹ã€‚=) ## The Pig Year of 2019:å¯çˆ±çš„çŒªå¹´å°è£…é¥°ï¼š.JPG) ##This restaurant is located in the countryside with ample parking space. It has 2 seperate rooms. Small but cosy. When I first visited it last year, it was still quite empty, but after a few times, this hidden gem has obviously been discovered - itâ€™s getting packed nowadays. And you see Chinese eaters here each time - always a great sign! :) ## ##The sweet girl at the reception told me her brother is the chef, and sheâ€™s responsible for the rest. posts.text: ##Hey hey, starting from today Iâ€™ll share some flatlay photos I did. Most pictures I posted here before were from my travels on the road - landscape, people, architecture, etc.. While I also had lots of flatlay photos done when I was at home or in the office. Actually this type of photos are pretty popular on some stock sites. =) I created the head image here as my entry for the VALENTINEâ€™S DAY PHOTO CONTEST 2019 by @flamingirl. Itâ€™s also joining the Qurator Photo Friday competition. As you can see, the concept is quite simple and straightforward: â€œLOVEâ€ made by a lipstick, a donut and cut rose petals. :) Here are the components I got (everything started from the lovely donuts in a supermarket on Valentineâ€™s Day ;p): .JPG) .jpg) ##So I first put the sweet donut covered with little â€œheartsâ€ on a piece of pink cardstock, and used a red lipstick to write down the letters â€œLâ€ and â€œVâ€. Then I cut a rose petal into 4 stripes to make a letter â€œEâ€. At last, shoot it with my phone. Thatâ€™s it! Easy peasy lemon squeezy! ;) .JPG) .JPG)ï‘† These are the original colors. With the Pantone color of 2019 in mind, I made the head image into something closer to Living Coralâ€¦ ;) ## Hope you enjoy this LOVE flatlay I did, and stay tuned for more flatlay photos from me! ï™‚ ##å—¨~ ä»Šå¤©å¼€å§‹ï¼Œæˆ‘æ‰“ç®—é™†ç»­åˆ†äº«ä¸€äº›è‡ªå·±æ‹çš„flatlayç…§ç‰‡ï¼Œè¿™ç§å¹³é“ºä¿¯æ‹ç‰‡è¿‘å‡ å¹´åœ¨Insä¸Šå’Œå„å›¾åº“ç½‘ç«™æ¯”è¾ƒæµè¡Œï¼Œå¸¸è§çš„æœ‰ä¸€æ¡Œå¥½åƒçš„æˆ–åŠå…¬ç”¨å“ã€ä¸€åœ°æŠ¤è‚¤å“æˆ–åŒ–å¦†å“ã€ä¸€åœ°å›¾çš„æ—…è¡Œç”¨å“ä¹‹ç±»ã€‚åœ¨Steemè¿™ä¸€å¹´å¤šæ¥ï¼Œæˆ‘å‘çš„ç…§ç‰‡å¤§éƒ½æ˜¯æ—…é€”ä¸­éšæ€§è€Œä¸ºçš„æŠ“æ‹ï¼Œå¥½åƒè¿˜æ²¡åŒ…æ‹¬è¿™ç§åœ¨å®¶æˆ–åŠå…¬å®¤æ‘†æ‹å°ç‰©ä»¶çš„ç…§ç‰‡ã€‚è¿™æ¬¡å…ˆæ¥å¼ â€œLOVEâ€ä¸»é¢˜çš„å¹³æ‹ï¼Œæ˜¯ä¸ºå‚åŠ @flamingirlæƒ…äººèŠ‚ä¸»é¢˜çš„æ´»åŠ¨ã€‚ï˜Š æ€è·¯ç›´è§‚ï¼Œç‰©å“ç®€å•ï¼š è¶…å¸‚ä¹°çš„æ´’æ»¡ç²‰è‰²ç³»ï’—çš„ç”œç”œåœˆæ„æˆO + å£çº¢æ¶‚çš„Lå’ŒV + å‰ªçš„4æ¡ç«ç‘°èŠ±ç“£ïŒ¹æ‹¼æˆE è™½ç„¶æˆ‘ä¸ªäººæ¯”è¾ƒå–œæ¬¢é»„ç»¿å’Œå¤§åœ°è‰²ç³»ï¼Œä½†è¿™äº›â¤æ»¡æ»¡çš„å¥³æ€§åŒ–å°ä¸œè¥¿ä¼¼ä¹åº”è¯¥æ­é…ç²‰è‰²çš„å¡çº¸ï¼Œæ”¾åœ°æ¿ä¸Šï¼Œæ‰‹æœºå’”åš“ä¸€ä¸‹å°±å®Œæˆäº†ã€‚ã€‚ã€‚ æ˜¯ä¸æ˜¯ç‚’é¸¡å®¹æ˜“ï¼Ÿï™‚ å› ä¸ºPantoneå‘å¸ƒçš„2019æµè¡Œè‰²æ˜¯æ´»åŠ›çŠç‘šæ©™ï¼Œæˆ‘åˆè°ƒäº†å¼ è°ƒå­æš–ä¸€ç‚¹çš„ä½œä¸ºè¿™é‡Œçš„é¢˜å›¾ã€‚ All content by @itchyfeetdonicaå›¾æ–‡ by Donicaå¤š Thank you for visiting! posts.text: ï‘† photo by me in La Paz, Bolivia ç…§ç‰‡æ‹äºç»åˆ©ç»´äºšé¦–éƒ½è¡—å¤´ ##Greetings everyone! Itâ€™s time to announce the winners of myã€Cross-culture Challengeã€‘! ï˜ƒ Iâ€™ve enjoyed reading through all the posts and comments, and Iâ€™m glad to see this challenge has inspired some Steemians to think about and to compare the different cultures they have experienced, and many of the entry posts have stimulated discussions on relevant topics. Iâ€™d like to thank all the participants and supporters! ï‘ And a huge shout out to @partiko! posts.text: ##I took this photo at Laguna Colorada (Red Lake) in Bolivia. The view of this high-altitude desert plain looks surreal to me. It is located in the southwest of the country, within Eduardo Avaroa Andean Fauna National Reserve and close to the border with Chile. The shallow salt lakeâ€™s reddish color is caused by red sediments and pigmentation of some algae. The white dots in the red lake are actually flamingos. Iâ€™ve shared some close-up photos of these beautiful birds before. Together with the blue sky, the floating clouds, the rolling hills, the highland steppe and the grazing llamas, the landscape is simply stunning, isnâ€™t it? :) ##è¿™æ˜¯ç»åˆ©ç»´äºšè¥¿å—éƒ¨çš„ä¸€å¤„çº¢æ¹–ï¼Œæ˜¯æ¿’å±ç«çƒˆé¸Ÿçš„æ –æ¯åœ°ã€‚ä»¥å‰è´´è¿‡è¿‘æ™¯ç«çƒˆé¸Ÿçš„ç…§ç‰‡ï¼Œå›¾ä¸Šè¿œå¤„çš„å°ç™½ç‚¹å°±æ˜¯æˆç¾¤çš„ç«çƒˆé¸Ÿåœ¨è§…é£Ÿã€‚çº¢æ¹–è¢«åˆ—ä¸ºå›½é™…æ‹‰å§†è¨å°”æ¹¿åœ°å…¬çº¦ä¸­çš„ä¸€å‘˜ï¼Œå—åˆ°ä¿æŠ¤ï¼Œä¸èƒ½é è¿‘ã€‚ä½†è¿œè¿œçœ‹ç€è¿™è“å¤©ç™½äº‘ã€ç«å±±çº¢æ¹–ã€é«˜åŸè‰ç”¸ï¼Œè¿˜æœ‰å‘¼å•¸çš„ç‹‚é£ä¸­æ‚ é—²å•ƒè‰çš„å‡ åŒ¹è‰æ³¥é©¬ï¼ŒçœŸæ˜¯ä¸èƒ½ä¸æ„Ÿå¹å¤§è‡ªç„¶æ¯äº²çš„é¬¼æ–§ç¥å·¥ï¼éš¾æ€ªæœ‰äººè¯´è¿™é‡Œçš„å¥‡æ™¯æ˜¯ä¸Šå¸æ‰“ç¿»äº†è°ƒè‰²ç›˜é€ æˆçš„~ ä½ è§‰å¾—å‘¢ï¼Ÿ=) é¢˜å›¾è¿™å¼ ç”¨æ¥å‚åŠ @ntopazçš„é£å…‰æ‘„å½±æ´»åŠ¨ï¼Œå‘å¸ƒæ—¶è¢«æˆªæˆ16ï¼š9ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ä¹Ÿå‘å¼ åŸå›¾ï¼š This is my entry for the photo contest by @ntopaz. posts.title: #197 At the Peak | å±±é¡¶
posts.text: ##You are right, this is the famous view from Victoria Peak of Hong Kong. It is known as The Peak, the highest hill on Hong Kong Island, with an elevation of 552 m. You might have seen this classic view lots of times from internet, TV, magazines or newspapers. Yeah, I visited it every time too when I went to HongKong as a tourist. Iâ€™ve no idea why - I guess itâ€™s just beautiful. ;) As itâ€™s so hot, I didnâ€™t feel like carrying a camera, so I snapped this shot with my phone. This is my entry to @axemanâ€™s Cityscape Photo Contest. posts.title: #196 Windmills at Sunset | æš®è‰²ä¸­çš„é£è½¦ç¾¤
posts.text: Hey, guess where these windmills are? You probably got it right - in the Netherlands! I shot this photo in the famous windmill village of Kinderdijk, close to Rotterdam. This place is best known for its 19 iconic windmills built in the first half of 18th century. I arrived in the afternoon and wandered around until sunset. By that time everything was closed, so it was quiet and peaceful. This waterway and the windmills were bathing in warm golden rays. Amazing serenity! Hope you enjoy this view as I did! =) This is my entry for the photo contest by @ntopaz. posts.text: ##Hey everyone! This is my entry post for the Graphics Design Contest: OnePageX, hosted by @mediaworks.Hereâ€™s their post if you are also interestd. :) ##å—¨~ è¿™æ˜¯æˆ‘ä¸ºå‚åŠ OnePageXçš„è®¾è®¡æ¯”èµ›è€Œè®¾è®¡çš„ä¿¡æ¯å›¾ã€‚ä¸‹é¢åˆ†äº«äº†è®¾è®¡æ„å›¾ã€è¿‡ç¨‹å’Œè¯æ˜~ ## â†‘ selfie proof with my design work ;) So what is OnePageX.com? ##It is an amazing online tool to quickly convert cryptocurrencies! OnePageX.com has over 140 cryptocurrencies listed. Besides, STEEM has been integrated as a base asset. It means that you can convert STEEM to any of the 140+ cryptocurrencies instantly! Great news for Steemians right? :) ##If you have a website where you want to offer your visitors an altcoin converter, you can also try the OneBox. It is easy to implement with a copy-paste of some code. The user never leaves your website, as everything happens inside the widget. My Post-Design ;) Brief: ##After exploring their website and relevant info, I decided to make an infographic to show the step-by-step instructions on how to use OnePageX.com. Based on my marketing experience, this type of simple chart with how-to steps is nice and handy to share on social media, such as Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, Pinterestâ€¦ and of course the blockchain social platforms! =) ##I first picked the background color from their website to apply as the canvas color for my infographic chart. To be in line with their siteâ€™s minimal style and the brand colors, I limited the chartâ€™s colors into green, white and blue. And I put their logo and homepage picture in the up middle of the chart. For the screenshot, I chose Steem (Of course! Also its color is still in the blue family of the background color, though itâ€™s quite a distant relativeâ€¦ ;p) and BCHAB (mainly because of its green and white logo) as an exchange example. I threw in their catchy taglines and the website address (Traffic! Traffic! Traffic! ) too. Then I summarised the 3 steps to use the site and visualized them with some icons. Thatâ€™s it! Easy peasy lemon squeezy~ :) ##My final design: ## What do you think of my design? posts.title: #200 Zugspitze & Blindsee â›° | æ¥šæ ¼å³°è¿œçœº
posts.text: Hey fellow Steemians! Today Iâ€™m sharing the amazing view I captured from Zugspitzblick. Itâ€™s near the Fernpass in Austria, close to the border with Germany. As its name Zugspitzblick suggests, this is a great point to enjoy the view of the Zugspitze peak. Standing at 2,962 m above sea level, the Zugspitze is the highest peak in Germany. The border between Austria and Germany runs over its western summit. The green lake you see here is Blindsee. With a visibility of about 30 m, its deep clear water and rich varieties of fish have attracted many divers. Mother nature never fails to impress me, and words always fail me when I face this kind of beauty. :) So just have a look at my photo. Hope you enjoy this view from the Alps like I did! This is my entry for the European Thursday Photo Challenge and @quratorâ€™s Photo Friday competition. ##ä»Šå¤©åˆ†äº«ä¸€å¼ æˆ‘åœ¨å¥¥åœ°åˆ©è’‚ç½—å°”å·æ¥šæ ¼å³°å±±åŒºçš„æ‰‹æœºæ‘„å½±ã€‚ç…§ç‰‡é‡Œçš„å±±æ˜¯å¾·å›½æœ€é«˜å³° â€”â€” æ¥šæ ¼å³°ï¼Œæµ·æ‹”2962ç±³ï¼Œå±äºé˜¿å°”å‘æ–¯å±±è„‰ã€‚ è¿™å±±ä½äºå¾·å›½å·´ä¼åˆ©äºšå·ï¼Œåœ¨å¥¥åœ°åˆ©è¾¹å¢ƒé™„è¿‘ã€‚è¿™æ¹–å«Blindseeï¼Œæµ·æ‹”1093ç±³ã€‚æ¹–æ°´å¾ˆæ¸…æ¾ˆï¼Œæ°´ä¸‹30ç±³å¯è§ï¼Œæ˜¯ç”±ä¸€ä¸ªå·¨å¤§çš„çŸ³ä½“æ»‘å¡åœ¨4100å¹´å‰å½¢æˆçš„ã€‚æ®è¯´æ¹–é‡Œé±¼ïŸç±»å“ç§ä¸°å¯Œï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥å¸å¼•äº†è®¸å¤šæ½œæ°´å‘˜å‰æ¥ä½“éªŒã€‚æˆ‘å°±è¿™æ ·è¿œè¿œåœ°çœ‹ç€ï¼Œå·²ç»ä¸ç”±å¯¹å¤§è‡ªç„¶è€æ¯äº²å¿ƒç”Ÿæ•¬ç•ï¼Œä»¥åå¦‚æœæœ‰æœºä¼šï¼Œä¹Ÿæƒ³ä¸‹æ°´å»è·Ÿè¿™æ¹–é‡Œçš„é±¼å„¿ä»¬æ‰“ä¸ªæ‹›å‘¼~ :) All content by @itchyfeetdonicaå›¾æ–‡ by Donicaå¤šphoto shot with iPhone 7 Thank you for visiting! posts.title: #201 STEEM Food Tours #50 | å‚åŠ ã€æ˜ŸæœŸä¸€å–èŒ¶ã€‘
posts.text: ##Hey, this is my dinner tonight in an Asian restaurant called Kyoto Sushi: fried rice with scampi and vegetables, and a cup of mint tea. Itâ€™s also my entry to join the 50th edition of the @STEEMFoodTours challenge by @jeffjagoe. Check it out and join the fun if you are a foodie too! :) As the restaurantâ€™s name suggests, itâ€™s focusing on different types of sushi. But since itâ€™s a raining and chilly night here in Belgium, I didnâ€™t feel like eating cold sushi. Instead, I ordered a plate of stir-fried rice and a cup of heart-warming tea. The food here is not top-notch, but pretty tasty. The dishes they serve are kind of Asian food fusion, like many other Asian eateries in Western countries, to cater to both locals as well as eaters from other countries. The staff is very friendly and their service is fast. But their square tables are a bit too tiny for all the food and drinks, especially when itâ€™s a huge portion. Iâ€™m not a big fan of their decor - too much red everywhere which makes me feel dizzy, haha. ## ## The mint tea(water) is fresh and not so sweet as the traditional Moroccan mint tea I tried, because thereâ€™s no sugar in it but aside. The picture is also my entry to the new challenge - â€œTea Timeâ€ in CN community, hosted by @aellly and @xiaoshancun. ##è¿™æ˜¯æˆ‘ä»Šå¤©çš„æ™šé¥­ï¼šè™¾ä»è”¬èœç‚’é¥­å’Œè–„è·èŒ¶ã€‚ä¸‹é¢è¿™å¼ è–„è·èŒ¶çš„ç…§ç‰‡å‚åŠ @aelllyå’Œ@xiaoshancunä¸»åŠçš„ã€æ˜ŸæœŸä¸€å–èŒ¶ã€‘#3ï¼Œè¿™å‘¨æ˜¯ç¬¬ä¸‰æœŸï¼Œæœ‰å…´è¶£çš„å°ä¼™ä¼´ä¸€èµ·æ¥ç©å§ï¼ ## All content by @itchyfeetdonicaå›¾æ–‡ by Donicaå¤š ##Posted using Partiko iOS Thank you for visiting! posts.text: How are you doing my Steem friends? Hereâ€™s my entry for the Peoplephotography by @worldcapture week #19 and Quratorâ€™s Photo Friday competition. Check out these contests and join the fun! =) I captured this photo near Pisac in the Sacred Valley of Peru. I was wandering around and was attracted by this cheerful girl who was walking down the stairs. The villages in this region are known for their locally made textiles. I did a post about one textile market in another village some days ago. Check it out if interested. Didnâ€™t she look pretty in these traditional outfits? I showed her the picture and we were both happy about it. :) I also made a black & white one like what is popular in street photography, but I prefer the first one that shows her colorful clothing. What do you think? posts.title: #204 My Entries for B&W Photo Contest ~ Reflections in Water | å€’å½±
posts.text: Reflections of Clouds and Hills | Kaprun, Austriaå¥¥åœ°åˆ©é˜¿å°”å‘æ–¯å±±åŒºçš„æ¹–ä¸­å€’å½± ## ##Hello everyone! Today Iâ€™m sharing some photos of reflections in water. The monochrome ones also serve as my entries for the B&W Photo Contest hosted by @daveks. ##The first entry is from the Austrian Alps in the beautiful region of Tyrol. Iâ€™ve loved this area - you can enjoy breathtaking views almost everywhere after some easy hikes, and itâ€™s normally less crowded and expensive than in similar places of Swiss or French Alps. I took these 2 photos by the lake of Klammsee in the Kaprun ski area. The water of these alpine lakes is usually very clear, so reflections are common sights here. :) ## ## ## Reflections of Boat Lifts and Trees | Wallonia, Belgiumæ¯”åˆ©æ—¶ç“¦éš†åŒºè¿æ²³ä¸­çš„èµ·èˆ¹å°å€’å½± ## ##This is an Ascenseur (hydraulic boat lift) located on the Ancien Canal Du Centre near La LouviÃ¨re of Belgium. 4 lifts with 15+ meters rise were built in the late 19th and early 20th century, and this place has been designated as a World Heritage Site by UNESCO. The lifts were used to overcome the difference of the water level (a rise by 66.2 meters) along the canal. You can see all the 4 boat lifts here if interested. This region used to be an important industrial belt in the country, but nowadays commercial traffic bypasses these old lifts and is handled by the huge StrÃ©py-Thieu boat lift, which was the highest in the world upon completion, with a rise of 73 meters. I arrived here at sunset and got to see this engineering marvel standing quietly with his reflection in the canal. That sense of past glory! ;) ## ## Reflections of Windmills | Kinderdijk, The Netherlandsè·å…°é£è½¦æ‘æ°´é“ä¸­çš„å€’å½± ## ##I shot this photo in the windmill village of Kinderdijk, close to Rotterdam. This place is best known for its 19 iconic windmills built in the first half of 18th century. I arrived in the afternoon and wandered around till the golden hour. By that time everything was closed and most visitors left, so the windmills and plants were bathing peacefully in warm rays by the waterway. I used to post photos from the same village but from different angles. ## ##So thatâ€™s it for my reflection shots. Which is your favorite one? Tell me in the comments please. =) ##ä»Šå¤©åˆ†äº«çš„æ˜¯æˆ‘åœ¨æ¬§æ´²ä¸‰å¤„æ‹çš„å‡ å¼ å€’å½±çš„ç…§ç‰‡ï¼Œä½ æœ€å–œæ¬¢å“ªä¸€å¼ å‘¢ï¼Ÿ All content by @itchyfeetdonicaå›¾æ–‡ by Donicaå¤šPhotos shot with iPhone 7 & Canon Kiss X3 Thank you for visiting! posts.text: Greetings everyone! In this post Iâ€™m showing you the famous carnival in Binche, an old town in the Wallonia part of Belgium. Binche carnival is an annual festival celebrating Shrove Tuesday (Mardi Gras) during the three days before Lent. Since today is Ash Wednesday, this yearâ€™s celebrations just took place the past 3 days. So Iâ€™m very excited to share my festive experience with you! :D I only visited Binche on one of the three days a few years ago, and it was a lot of fun, despite the cold and wet weather. This tradition dates back to around the 14th century and has been recognized as UNESCO heritage. During the carnival each year, over a thousand local males and children dress up as several figures to perform in medieval parade. ## ##å—¨~ å—åˆ°SteemitBoardå’ŒWhereinèŠ‚æ—¥åˆ†äº«æ´»åŠ¨çš„å¯å‘ï¼Œä»Šå¤©å°±è¯·è·Ÿæˆ‘åˆ°æ¯”åˆ©æ—¶çš„ç­ä»€æ„Ÿå—ä¸€ä¸‹ä¸€å¹´ä¸€åº¦çš„ç‹‚æ¬¢èŠ‚ã€‚ æœ€è¿‘æ˜¯ç‹‚æ¬¢èŠ‚é«˜å‘æœŸï¼Œä½ å¯èƒ½å¬è¿‡æ„å¤§åˆ©å¨å°¼æ–¯çš„ç‹‚æ¬¢èŠ‚ï¼Œæ¬§æ´²çš„å››å¤§ç‹‚æ¬¢èŠ‚è¿˜æœ‰ä¸‰ä¸ªåˆ†åˆ«åœ¨æ³•å›½å°¼æ–¯ï¼Œå¾·å›½ç§‘éš†å’Œæ¯”åˆ©æ—¶å—éƒ¨æ³•è¯­åŒºçš„è¿™ä¸ªä¸­ä¸–çºªå°å¤åŸ â€”â€” ç­ä»€ã€‚çœŸæ˜¯éš¾å¾—ï¼Œè¿™ä¹ˆä½è°ƒçš„å›½å®¶ç«Ÿç„¶å…‰è£è·»èº«Top 4! æˆ‘æ¥æ¯”åˆ©æ—¶ä¹‹å‰å®Œå…¨ä¸çŸ¥é“è¿™ä¸ªåœ°æ–¹çš„å­˜åœ¨å’Œå®ƒæ¯å¹´ä¸€æ¬¡çš„ç‹‚æ¬¢èŠ‚ã€‚ ä»Šå¹´ç­ä»€çš„åº†ç¥å°±åœ¨åˆšåˆšè¿‡å»çš„è¿™ä¸‰å¤©ï¼å› ä¸ºä»Šå¤©æ˜¯åœ£ç°æ˜ŸæœŸä¸‰ï¼Œæ•™ä¼šä¸¾è¡Œæ¶‚ç°ç¤¼ï¼ŒæŠŠå»å¹´ç¥åœ£è¿‡çš„æ£•æçƒ§æˆç°æ¶‚åœ¨æ•™å‹çš„é¢å¤´ä¸Šï¼Œè±¡å¾æ‚”æ”¹ã€‚è¿™æ˜¯å¤§æ–‹æœŸçš„ç¬¬ä¸€å¤©ï¼Œè€Œå¾ˆå¤šå˜‰å¹´åçš„ç”±æ¥å°±æ˜¯å¤§æ–‹å¼€å§‹å‰çš„æœ€åç‹‚æ¬¢æ”¾çºµï¼Œä¹Ÿæ˜¯è¾æ—§å²è¿æ–°æ˜¥ã€‚ æ¯”åˆ©æ—¶çš„è¿™ä¸ªä¹Ÿæ˜¯å†å²æ‚ ä¹…ï¼Œæ®è¯´å¯ä»¥è¿½æº¯åˆ°14ä¸–çºªï¼ˆç„¶é¹…ç™¾åº¦ç™¾ç§‘è¯´æ˜¯â€œ1554å¹´ç½—é©¬å¸å›½çš‡å¸çš„å¦¹å¦¹ç›åˆ©äºšåœ¨ç­ä»€é€ åŸæ± ã€å»ºå®«æ®¿ï¼Œä¸ºæ¬¢è¿å¤–ç”¥è²åˆ©æ™®äºŒä¸–ä¸¾è¡Œç››å¤§å®´ä¼šï¼Œå®«å»·å®˜å‘˜äºæ˜¯åŒ–è£…æˆå„ç§è¾¾å®˜è´µäººå‚åŠ å®´ä¼šã€‚â€ï¼‰ï¼Œå·²ç»è¢«è”åˆå›½æ•™ç§‘æ–‡ç»„ç»‡è®¤å®šä¸ºäººç±»å£è¿°å’Œéç‰©è´¨é—äº§ã€‚åˆšæŸ¥äº†ä¸‹ï¼Œä¸­å›½åœ¨è¿™åå½•ä¸Šçš„æœ‰æ˜†æ›²ã€å¤ç´ã€æ–°ç–†ç»´å¾å°”çš„æœ¨å¡å§†è‰ºæœ¯å’Œè’™å¤æ—çš„é•¿è°ƒæ°‘æ­Œã€‚ å½“åœ°å±…æ°‘å¯¹è¿™ä¸ªå¤è€çš„ä¼ ç»Ÿæ·±æ„Ÿè‡ªè±ªï¼Œè‡ªå‘å‚ä¸æ¸¸è¡Œï¼Œè®©éšç€ç‹‚æ¬¢èŠ‚ä¿ç•™ä¸‹æ¥çš„éŸ³ä¹ã€èˆè¹ˆã€æœé¥°ã€é“å…·åˆ¶ä½œç­‰å¾—ä»¥ä»£ä»£ç›¸ä¼ ã€‚é‚£äº›è¿ç»­50å¹´æ‰®è£…æˆå‰å‹’çš„å±…æ°‘è¿˜ä¼šè¢«å¸‚é•¿æˆäºˆçºªå¿µå¥–ç« ã€‚æˆ‘å‡ å¹´å‰å»å‡‘äº†ä¸‹çƒ­é—¹ï¼Œåœ¨äºŒæœˆï¼Œè™½ç„¶ä¸€è´¯çš„å¯’å†·é˜´æ²‰ï¼Œä¹Ÿæ²¡æœ‰æ‹‰ä¸æ—ç¾¤é‚£ç§ç‹‚çƒ­çš„æ°”æ°›ï¼Œä½†è¿˜æ˜¯å¾ˆæ¬¢ä¹åœ°ã€‚:D ##Decorations on local windows: å½“åœ°çª—ä¸Šçš„èŠ‚æ—¥è£…é¥°ï¼š .JPG) .JPG) ##First, I saw some kids marching through the streets. The main figures in the proceedings are called Gilles. They wear clown-like costumes with bells, and their unique clogs donâ€™t look so easy to walk with. Some of them wear large hats adorned with fluffy ostrich plumes. Itâ€™s said that local men see being a Gille at the carnival as a kind of honor. Itâ€™s cool that the residents here try to preserve this old tradition generation after generation. Actually, since I was a night owl, I missed the early morning parade of the carnivalâ€™s final day, when Gilles in wax masks (in the last photo) danced to drum beat and warded off evil spirits with sticks. å…ˆæ˜¯çœ‹åˆ°ä¸€äº›å°å­©å‡ºè¡—æ¸¸è¡Œã€‚ä¸‹é¢è¿™ç§è£…æŸçš„æ˜¯ç‹‚æ¬¢èŠ‚çš„æ ¸å¿ƒè§’è‰² â€”â€” å‰å‹’ã€‚ä»–ä»¬èº«ç©¿ç±»ä¼¼å°ä¸‘çš„æœè£…ï¼Œé…æœ‰é“ƒé“›ï¼Œè„šè¸çœ‹ä¸Šå»æœ‰äº›ç¬¨é‡çš„æœ¨å±ï¼Œæœ‰äº›å¤´æˆ´è¶…å¤§çš„é©¼é¸Ÿæ¯›å¸½å­ï¼Œç‰¹è‰²é²œæ˜ï¼š .JPG) .JPG) .JPG) .JPG) .JPG) .JPG) ##Another 3 groups in different colorful costumes: è¿˜æœ‰å…¶ä»–ä¸‰ç»„èº«ç€å„è‰²æœè£…çš„å°å­©å­ï¼Œæœ‰å‡ ä¸ªçœŸæ˜¯å¤ªèŒäº†ï¼š .JPG) .JPG) .JPG) .JPG) .JPG) .JPG) .JPG) .JPG) .JPG) .JPG) .JPG) ##These ostrich plumes decorated hats are very finely made, costing about 200 euros to rent: è¿™äº›é©¼é¸Ÿç¾½æ¯›å¸½åšå·¥ç²¾è‡´ï¼Œä»·å€¼ä¸è²ï¼Œæ®è¯´è¦èŠ±200æ¬§å·¦å³æ‰èƒ½ç§Ÿåˆ°ä¸€é¡¶ï¼š .JPG) .JPG) .JPG) .JPG) .JPG) .JPG) ##They carry a basket full of oranges and throw them to the crowds while marching. posts.text: ##Hereâ€™s a scene I captured in a shop in ValparaÃ­so, a charming colorful city on Chileâ€™s coast. I entered this crafts shop and saw a young man teaching an elderly man how to use the laptop. Perhaps the young man was the owner and this apprentice was his grandpa. :) Itâ€™s lovely to see the excited student trying out the new technology that he might never heard of in his young age, surrounded by the flowery decorations, modern stickers and cute trinkets. I believe we both had fun. Itâ€™s my second entry for @ntopazâ€™s Opposing Beauty Photography Contest and for People Photography by @worldcapture. posts.title: #207 Smartphone Photography - Copacabana ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡´ | ä¾å±±å‚æ¹–çš„ç§‘åŸ
posts.text: ##Hey, here are the photos I took with my phone in Copacabana, a Bolivian town close to the border with Peru. That late afternoon, I was wandering around in town by Lake Titicaca, the worldâ€™s highest navigable body of water. Suddenly I discovered a narrow trail leading uphill, so I decided to explore where it would lead to. For some parts I had to use my hands to climb up the steep cliffs, and itâ€™s not that easy to ascend in the very thin air. It turned out to be totally worthy - when I reached the hill top at sunset, the view was just breathtaking (quite literally too as I almost lost my breath ;p). The cityâ€™s colorful houses spreaded along the green hills, and the vast Lake Titicaca looked like an endless stretch of the deep blue sea. You might have heard of the world-renowned Copacabana beach in Rio de Janeiro? In fact, that more famous cousin takes its name from this town. :) In the local language Aymara, Copacabana means â€œview of the lakeâ€, deriving from â€œkota kawanaâ€. Later in Rio, people found the shape of their beach resembled the crescent one here in Bolivia (as you can see in my photos), so they called it the same name. ## ##The first photo is my entry to Quratorâ€™s Photo Friday competition, and below is the location - you can get an idea of Lake Titicacaâ€™s size: ##æˆ‘ä»ç§˜é²é™†è·¯è¿‡å¢ƒåï¼Œæ¥åˆ°ç»åˆ©ç»´äºšçš„è¾¹å¢ƒå°åŸç§‘å¸•å¡å·´çº³(Copacabana)ã€‚é‚£å¤©ä¸‹åˆï¼Œç‹¬è‡ªåœ¨åŸå†…çš„çš„çš„å–€å–€æ¹–è¾¹çé€›ï¼Œçªç„¶çœ‹åˆ°æ¡ä¸Šå±±çš„å°è·¯ï¼Œå†³å®šæ¢ç´¢ä¸€ä¸‹ã€‚æœ‰äº›åœ°æ–¹å¾ˆé™¡ï¼Œéœ€è¦æ‰‹è„šå¹¶ç”¨åœ°ç¿»è¿‡å±±çŸ³ï¼Œè€Œä¸”é«˜åŸåœ°å¸¦ç©ºæ°”ç¨€è–„ï¼Œç­‰æˆ‘å¥½ä¸å®¹æ˜“çˆ¬åˆ°å±±é¡¶ï¼Œæ°”éƒ½å¿«æ²¡äº†ã€‚ä½†çœ‹åˆ°çš„è¿™ç•ªç¾æ™¯çœŸæ˜¯æ— æ³•ç”¨è¯­è¨€å½¢å®¹ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥æˆ‘å°±å‘äº†ä¸¤å¼ æ‰‹æœºæ‹çš„ç…§ç‰‡^^ã€‚ åœ¨å·´è¥¿æ—¶ï¼Œå»è¿‡é‡Œçº¦çƒ­å†…å¢é‚£ä¸ªä¸–ç•Œé—»åçš„æµ·æ»©ï¼Œä¹Ÿå«Copacabanaï¼Œæ®è¯´å°±æ˜¯å› ä¸ºå‘ç°é‚£é‡Œçš„æµ·æ¹¾ç±»ä¼¼è¿™å„¿çš„æ–°æœˆçŠ¶ï¼Œä¸çŸ¥é“è¿™èƒ½ä¸èƒ½å«å¢™é‡Œå¼€èŠ±å¢™å¤–é¦™ï¼Ÿç»“æœé‡Œçº¦çš„é‚£ç‰‡æ€§æ„Ÿæ²™æ»©æ¯”è¿™ä¸ªé«˜åŸå±±åŸçš„ä¸€å¼¯æ–°æœˆè¦å‡ºåå¾—å¤š~ã€‚æ ¹æ®ç»åˆ©ç»´äºšè¿™é‡Œå½“åœ°çš„è¯­è¨€ï¼Œè¿™ä¸ªå°åŸè¢«å«åšâ€œæ¹–æ™¯â€(kota kawana)ï¼Œçœ‹æ¥æˆ‘æ— æ„ä¸­å‘ç°çš„è§‚æ™¯ç‚¹ç«Ÿç„¶å®Œå…¨getåˆ°äº†æ­¤åŸçš„ç²¾å~ çœŸæ˜¯å¤ªå¹¸è¿äº†! :) Posted using Partiko iOS All content by @itchyfeetdonicaå›¾æ–‡ by Donicaå¤šPhotos shot with iPhone 7 Thank you for visiting! posts.title: #209 STEEM Food Tours #52 - Ramen ğŸœ | æš–å¿ƒæ‹‰é¢
posts.text: ##Greetings everyone! I had Tonkotsu ramen as dinner in an Asian restaurant called Kaishu in Maastricht last weekend. This type of ramen is famous for its rich broth made from simmered pork marrow or pork bone. ## A good broth is supposed to be prepared by boiling the bones for around 10 hours or more. But I guess not every ramen restaurant has put this amount of time into it to get the real broth done, especially when it comes to some localized ones out of Japan. ##According to Seriouseats: You often see ramen categorized into four classes: shio (salt), shoyu (soy sauce), miso (fermented bean paste), and tonkotsu (pork), which doesnâ€™t make particular sense, as the first three are flavorings, while the fourth is the broth base. ##To be honest, the soup of this ramen I ordered was not so rich as I expected, but itâ€™s a full photogenic bowl, and I was grateful that I found this heartwarming tasty food in a frigid windy night. ï˜‹ .JPG) Address: .JPG) .JPG) ##More Foodie Posts:æ›´å¤šåƒè´§å¸–ï¼š Cook with Donica - Make a Savory Crepe | è‡ªåˆ¶ç…é¥¼ A Szechuan Restaurant in Belgium ï‡¨ï‡³ï²ï‡§ï‡ª | æ¯”åˆ©æ—¶æ­£å®—å·èœé¦†æ¨è Cooking Video: Creamy Garlic Scampi ï¦ | ç¾å‘³è’œé¦™è™¾åšæ³•è§†é¢‘ Japanese Food Experience in a German Medieval Town ï± ï‡©ï‡ª | å¾·å›½ç«¥è¯å¤é•‡çš„æ—¥é¤æ¨è Cook with Donica - Fish with Pickled Cabbage ï‘©â€ | ä¸€èµ·æ¥åšé…¸èœé±¼ Cook with Donica - Braised Pork with Tofu and Shiitake ï² | è·Ÿæˆ‘åšé¦™è‡è±†è…çº¢çƒ§è‚‰ Cook with Donica - Satay Fried Rice ï› | æ¥åšç®€å•ç¾å‘³çš„æ²™çˆ¹ç‚’é¥­ Foodieâ€™s Photo Journal of Sydney Fish Market ï  | å¸¦ä½ é€›æ‚‰å°¼æµ·é²œå¸‚åœº Vietnamese Street Food - Mini-Pancakesï¥ ï‡»ï‡³ | è¶Šå—è¡—å¤´çš„è¿·ä½ ç…é¥¼ Dirty Duck Restaurant in Ubud, Bali ï¦† ï‡®ï‡© | è„é¸­é¦†çš„ç¾é£Ÿæ•…äº‹ Come Visit the Rotterdam Market Hall with Me ï§€ï‡³ï‡± | å·ç§°å…¨çƒé¢œå€¼æœ€é«˜çš„èœå¸‚åœºé•¿ä»€ä¹ˆæ ·ï¼Ÿ All content by @itchyfeetdonicaå›¾æ–‡ by Donicaå¤šPhotos shot with iPhone 7 Thank you for visiting! posts.title: #210 Addis Ababa (1) | åŸƒå¡é¦–éƒ½å‰ªå½±
posts.text: The sad news of Ethiopian Airlines plane crash these days has brought my memory back to my solo trip in Ethiopia. I flew with the same airline from Sao Paulo of Brazil to the capital of Ethiopia in 2017, and traveled 2 weeks in the country. So Iâ€™m going to share some photos I took there. The one you see in this post was shot at the street of its largest city Addis Ababa. I walked past a dozen construction sites and was on my way to Red Terror Martyrs Memorial Museum. The owner of the guest house where I stayed suggested that I visit this place. It was late afternoon. The lazy sun was hanging low in the sky. A warm shade was cast on the enormous overpass, vehicles, pedestrians and the shining wet ground. Heavy traffic, fumes and noises. I stopped at the red light. 2 Muslim ladies in headscarf were crossing the wide road in that perfect lighting. As a photography enthusiast, I just couldnâ€™t help capturing this moment. :) A bit to the left (you can see Ethiopian Airlinesâ€™ logo at the top right corner): è¿™å‡ å¤©ä¸æ–­çœ‹åˆ°åŸƒå¡ä¿„æ¯”äºšèˆªç©ºæ³¢éŸ³737å¤±äº‹æƒ¨å‰§çš„æœ€æ–°æ¶ˆæ¯ï¼Œä¸å¹¸é‡éš¾çš„åŒèƒä¸­è¿˜æœ‰ä¸ªåœ¨åŸƒå¡è½¬æœºï¼Œæ‰“ç®—å»è‚¯å°¼äºšæ¯•ä¸šæ—…è¡Œçš„æµ™æ±Ÿå¥³ç”Ÿã€‚è®©æˆ‘æƒ³èµ·è‡ªå·±ä¸€å¹´å¤šå‰ä¹Ÿæ˜¯åç€åŒä¸€èˆªå¸çš„é£æœºä»å·´è¥¿çš„åœ£ä¿ç½—é£åˆ°åŸƒå›½é¦–éƒ½ï¼Œå¼€å§‹ç‹¬é—¯éæ´²ï¼Œä¸ç¦å”å˜˜ã€‚ ä»¥å‰å†™è¿‡ç¯‡é¦–éƒ½æœºåœºæƒŠé­‚è®°ï¼Œå‘è¿‡å‡ å¼ åœ¨åŸƒå¡ä¿„æ¯”äºšå—éƒ¨åŸå§‹éƒ¨è½é‡Œæ‹çš„ç…§ç‰‡ï¼Œè¿™æ¬¡çš„ä¸¤å¼ æ‹äºé¦–éƒ½äºšçš„æ–¯äºšè´å·´è¡—å¤´ã€‚æ–œé˜³å¤•ç…§ï¼Œç«‹äº¤æ¡¥ã€é«˜æ¥¼ã€è¡Œäººã€è½¦æµã€ç§¯æ°´çš„è·¯é¢â€¦â€¦ éƒ½è¢«ç¬¼ä¸Šä¸€å±‚æš–é›¾ã€‚å™ªéŸ³ã€å°¾æ°”ã€å³ä¸Šæ–¹çš„åŸƒèˆªæ ‡å¿—ã€ä¸è¿œå¤„çš„å·¥åœ°å’Œæˆ‘çš„ç›®çš„åœ° â€”â€” çº¢è‰²ææ€–æ®‰éš¾è€…çºªå¿µé¦†ï¼ˆå®¢æ ˆè€æ¿å»ºè®®æˆ‘å»é‚£é‡Œäº†è§£ä¸‹ä»–ä»¬å›½å®¶è¿™æ®µæƒ¨ç—›çš„å†å²ï¼‰â€¦â€¦ æˆ‘åœ¨çº¢ç¯çš„è·¯å£åœä¸‹è„šæ­¥ï¼Œä¸¤åè£¹ç€å¤´å·¾çš„ç©†æ–¯æ—å¥³å£«å¿«æ­¥ç©¿è¿‡å¤§é©¬è·¯ï¼Œå‡ ä¹å®Œç¾çš„å…‰å½±ç¬é—´ã€‚ All content by @itchyfeetdonicaå›¾æ–‡ by Donicaå¤š ##Posted using Partiko iOS Thank you for visiting! posts.text: ##I visited ValparaÃ­so, the charming port city on Chileâ€™s coast when living in the countryâ€™s capital Santiago. Itâ€™s a bit over 1 hour by car from Santiago, and there are plenty of public buses connecting the 2 cities as well. ValparaÃ­so boasts colorful houses along the hills and even more coloful graffiti all over the house walls. :) Itâ€™s called Chileâ€™s Cultural Capital due to its booming art and culture scene. Itâ€™s great fun to take the steep funiculars to those hilltops, where you can visit the abundant beautiful architectures and artsy shops. Along your ride, you also get fantastic views of the buildings, the hills, the port and the vast Pacific ocean. ##ç“¦å°”å¸•è±ç´¢æ˜¯ä¸ªå¤šå§¿å¤šå½©ã€å¾ˆæœ‰å‘³é“çš„å¬‰çš®å°åŸï¼Œè¢«ç§°ä¸ºæ™ºåˆ©çš„â€œæ–‡åŒ–ä¹‹éƒ½â€ã€‚ä½äºæ™ºåˆ©é¦–éƒ½åœ£åœ°äºšå“¥ä»¥è¥¿çš„å¤ªå¹³æ´‹æ²¿å²¸ï¼Œä»é¦–éƒ½å‡ºå‘çš„è¯ï¼Œè‡ªé©¾ä¸€ä¸ªå°æ—¶å¤šä¸€ç‚¹ï¼Œåå¤§å·´è¿‘ä¸¤ä¸ªå°æ—¶ã€‚è¿™é‡Œè·Ÿå¤§å®¶åˆ†äº«çš„æ˜¯æˆ‘åç¼†è½¦ä¸Šå±±åä¿¯ç°åˆ°çš„æ¸¯å£æ™¯è‰²ã€‚ ## ##In this post, Iâ€™m showing you the views of the port I got after ascending to high up by a funicular. ValparaÃ­soâ€™s port is divided into ten sites, and the last two include a dock and are used as public walks and cruise passenger terminal. As a main container and passenger port in the country, it transfers 10 million tons each year, and serves about 50 cruises. The cityâ€™s port received a large number of immigrants, primarily from Europe from 1848 till 1914. As a result, neighbourhoods of different styles were built on ValparaÃ­soâ€™s hillsides. Among these Historic Districts, the most prominant ones are legacies by the British, Germans, and Italians. Nowadays, they are preserved as â€œZonas TÃ­picasâ€. ## All content by @itchyfeetdonicaå›¾æ–‡ by Donicaå¤š Thank you for visiting! Please tell me what you think. posts.text: When I say Vietnamese food, whatâ€™s the first thing popping into your mind? Phá»Ÿ? ï™‚ Originated from northern Vietnam in the early 20th century, this delicious noodle soup has been popularized in other parts of the world by refugees after the Vietnam War. Well, Vietnamese people might laugt at it, since they surely have so much more to offer than this little bowl of noodle soup. But after trying out different food around Vietnam, I have to say phá»Ÿ is still one of my favorites. ï˜„ ## Here Iâ€™m sharing some photos of the Phá»Ÿ bÃ² (beef noodle soup) I had in Hanoi, the countryâ€™s capital. Since my friend Joy is traveling there right now and we talked about the local food. Phá»Ÿ consists of beef or chicken broth, herbs, and rice noodles called bÃ¡nh phá»Ÿ. Phá»Ÿ bÃ² is with beef cuts and Phá»Ÿ gÃ  has chicken in it. When I was in Hanoi, I ate it almost any time of the day, but when I went to the south of Vietnam, itâ€™s more difficult to find it after breakfast time. The size of the rice noodles, the choice of herbs and the taste of the broth are also different. ## ## ##å› ä¸ºè€æœ‹å‹Joyæ­£åœ¨è¶Šå—çš„é¦–éƒ½æ²³å†…æ¸¸ç©ï¼Œé—®æˆ‘ä»¥å‰åœ¨é‚£åƒäº†å•¥å¥½åƒçš„ï¼Œæˆ‘åœ¨æ‰‹æœºé‡Œä¸€é€šæœç´¢ï¼Œæ‰¾åˆ°äº›æ²³å†…é€›åƒçš„ç…§ç‰‡ï¼Œè¿™æ¬¡å…ˆæ¥åˆ†äº«ä¸ªè¶Šå—æœ‰åçš„æ²³ç²‰ã€‚ 20ä¸–çºªæ—©æœŸï¼Œè¶Šå—æ²³ç²‰èµ·æºäºå›½å®¶çš„åŒ—éƒ¨ï¼Œä¹Ÿå°±æ˜¯æ²³å†…æ‰€åœ¨çš„é‚£å—åœ°åŒºã€‚è¶Šå—æˆ˜äº‰åè¢«éš¾æ°‘å¸¦åˆ°ä¸–ç•Œå„åœ°ï¼Œå¹¿å—æ¬¢è¿ã€‚è¥¿æ–¹å›½å®¶å¤§åŸå¸‚çš„è¡—å¤´ä¹Ÿå¸¸å¸¸èƒ½çœ‹åˆ°å–è¶Šå—æ²³ç²‰çš„åº—ã€‚ å½“ç„¶ï¼Œå¦‚æœæˆ‘ä»¬ä¸€æè¶Šå—èœå°±è¯´æ²³ç²‰ï¼Œè¶Šå—äººä¼°è®¡ä¼šå‘ç¬‘ï¼Œå› ä¸ºæ¯•ç«Ÿè¿˜æœ‰é‚£ä¹ˆå¤šå…¶ä»–ç¾é£Ÿå‘¢ã€‚ç„¶é¹…ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»åŒ—åˆ°å—åƒäº†ä¸€åœˆå„ç§èœï¼Œè¿˜æ˜¯è§‰å¾—æ²³ç²‰æœ€åˆèƒƒå£ï¼Œå“ˆå“ˆâ€¦â€¦ æˆ‘è¿™æ˜¯çƒ‚æ³¥æ‰¶ä¸ä¸Šå¢™çš„åˆ˜é˜¿æ–—å—ï¼Ÿï˜„ ä¸€èˆ¬è¶Šå—æ²³ç²‰æœ‰é¸¡è‚‰å’Œç‰›è‚‰ä¸¤ç§å£å‘³ï¼ŒåŒ—æ–¹å’Œå—æ–¹ç”¨çš„ç±³ç²‰å®½åº¦ã€æ±¤å¤´å‘³é“å’Œé¦™è‰ïŒ¿é…æ–™ä¹Ÿæœ‰ä¸åŒã€‚æˆ‘è¿™é‡Œå‘çš„æ˜¯åœ¨åŒ—æ–¹çš„æ²³å†…ä¸€å®¶å°åº—åƒåˆ°çš„ç‰›è‚‰æ²³ç²‰ã€‚åœ¨æ²³å†…å’Œå…¶ä»–åŒ—æ–¹åœ°åŒºæ—¶ï¼Œä¸€å¤©åˆ°æ™šè¡—å¤´éƒ½æœ‰æ²³ç²‰å–ï¼Œä½†åæ¥åˆ°äº†å—éƒ¨ï¼Œè¿‡äº†åƒæ—©é¤çš„æ—¶é—´ï¼Œå°±å¾ˆéš¾æ‰¾åˆ°æ²³ç²‰æ‘Šå­äº†ã€‚ ##Address:åœ°å€ï¼š This is my entry for Quratorâ€™s Tasty Tuesday competition, and here are 2 more posts I did before about Vietnam: å¦å¤–ï¼Œä»¥å‰å‘è¿‡è¶Šå—è¡—å¤´çš„è¿·ä½ ç…é¥¼ï¼Œè¿˜æœ‰åœ¨ç¾å›½åç››é¡¿å’Œè¶Šå—çš„èƒ¡å¿—æ˜å¸‚å‚è§‚ä¸¤ä¸ªè¶Šå—æˆ˜äº‰çºªå¿µé¦†çš„ç»å†ï¼š Vietnamese Street Food - Mini-Pancakesï¥ ï‡»ï‡³ | è¶Šå—è¡—å¤´çš„è¿·ä½ ç…é¥¼ https://steemitimages.com/DQmPU4sqvSZUrDHS3frjAbNGJ74UmN8u8B4gExDG4bA58uc/IMG_0708.JPG ## Visiting Vietnam Veterans Memorial ï‡ºï‡¸ + War Remnants Museum ï‡»ï‡³ | è¶Šå—æˆ˜äº‰åŒé¦†è®° https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmQqZfP1qhWxohUbGh9xEjYt1fyHTSaE3BQ1cYwMfuqJya/IMG_6947.JPG All content by @itchyfeetdonicaå›¾æ–‡ by Donicaå¤š Thank you for visiting! posts.title: #216 Follow Me to Neuschwanstein Castle ğŸ° ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡ª | æ¢¦å¹»æ–°å¤©é¹…å ¡
posts.text: ##Whatâ€™s up fellow Steemians! You might have heard of Neuschwanstein Castle, which inspired Sleeping Beautyâ€™s castle in Disneyland? So follow me today to visit this famous palace nestled in the idyllic Bavarian Alps! :) å¤§å®¶å¥½å‘€~ ä½ ä»¬å¬è¿‡å¾·å›½çš„ç½‘çº¢æ–°å¤©é¹…å ¡å§ï¼Ÿæ²¡é”™ï¼Œå°±æ˜¯è¿ªå£«å°¼ä¹å›­é‡Œç¡ç¾äººåŸå ¡çš„åŸå‹ï¼æ®è¯´ä¹Ÿå¯å‘äº†1950å¹´å»ºæˆçš„ç°å§‘å¨˜åŸå ¡ã€‚ä»Šå¤©å°±è¯·è·Ÿæˆ‘åˆ°å·´ä¼åˆ©äºšå·ï¼Œä¸€è·¯ä¸Šå±±æ¥çœ‹çœ‹è¿™ä¸ªæ¢¦å¹»åŸå ¡å’Œå®ƒå‘¨å›´è®©äººæƒŠè‰³çš„è‡ªç„¶ç¯å¢ƒã€‚ ##As you can see from the map of my phone, the castle is located on a hill above the village of Hohenschwangau near FÃ¼ssen in the southwest of Germany. Most visitors start the trip from Hohenschwangau where the ticket center is located. ##The route map I found on a road sign: ##Some easy walking at the beginning: ##En route I got this view of the castle - Hohenschwangau perched on a little hill, and the brilliant sunset. This older castle was where King Ludwig II spent his childhood, and it had been overshadowed by the shing new castle ever since its completion. ##Actually Neuschwanstein Castle was originally called New Hohenschwangau Castle, and itâ€™s given a new name after Ludwig IIâ€™s death. Literally meaning â€œNew Swan Stone Castleâ€, it is a reference to the influential and controversial composer Richard Wagnerâ€™s character, the Swan Night. King Ludwig II of Bavaria commissioned the castle as a retreat on a rugged cliff in 1868, 2 years after he lost his powers as a result of the Austro-Prussian War. However, he never saw the final Neuschwanstein castle. The last towers were only finished 6 years after his sudden death in 1886. After this charming Romanesque Revival palace was opened to the public, it quickly became one of the most visited castles in the world. Its white limestone faÃ§ade and blue turrets are said to be real-life inspiration for the Disney Cinderella castle as well. ##Pictures and commentaries on my way - the castle seen from the west and the northwest: ##Getting closer: ##Looking up at the Neuschwanstein Castle: ##The tunnel inside: ##Below is the view I captured from the very high MarienbrÃ¼ckeâ€ (Maryâ€™s bridge), situated above PÃ¶llat gorge. What impressed me the most was not the Neuschwanstein Castle itself, but rather how it blended into the stunning natural settings around. I visited it in September when the surrounding foliage just started to turn yellow, while green was still the dominant color. Judging from the photos I saw taken in other seasons, this place is amazingly beautiful all year round. Iâ€™d love to visit it in future in other times of the year and to do more hikings in the forests nearby. ##After crossing the bridge, I found a narrow trail leading high up. Thinking that it would be a great vantage point for photos, I decided to hike along: ##The trail was almost blocked at the end, and I had to climb with my hands at the last part. But itâ€™s a lot of fun to explore, and itâ€™s rewarding to see the panoramic view in the golden hour. :) ##View from that hilltop: The head image in this post was taken from the same vantage point, and itâ€™s my entry to @quratorâ€™s Photo Friday competition. So thatâ€™s it for today. Have you visited this world-renowned palace? Howâ€™s your experience?
